b'commit 8c13d3cdf9590c06c40475420cc80af6001931bf
Author: Markus KEMP (JV) <markus.kemp.jv@valeo.com>
Date:   Tue Mar 1 13:55:36 2022 +0100

    $DEVOPS-1446$ - Generalize AUTOSAR build (one interface : multiple implementations (Elektrobit Tresos Studio, Vector DaVinci, etc ...))
    
    Also cleaned remnants of ADIS (was removed in change https://erl1-git.vnet.valeo.com/#/c/Optimus_100KW_Software/+/80195/, but removal was incomplete).
    
    tools/cm -> 42.0.0
    
    Change-Id: Ic4ebeb847cb8088426310f5a4b51db22809ad514

diff --git a/src/fw_cu/Components/Extern/AutoCore/eclipse/plugins/Spi_TS_T16D15M4I9R0/generate/templates/Spi_UserCode.c b/src/fw_cu/Components/Extern/AutoCore/eclipse/plugins/Spi_TS_T16D15M4I9R0/generate/templates/Spi_UserCode.c

@@ -1,103 +0,0 @@
-/**
- * \\file Spi_UserCode.c
- *
- * \\brief AUTOSAR MCAL templates
- *
- * This file contains a template implementation of an initialization
- * function to configure the Spi DMA transfer in asynchronous mode.
- *
- * \\par To be changed by user: yes
- *
- * \\author Elektrobit Automotive GmbH, 91058 Erlangen, Germany
- *
- * Copyright 2005 - 2016 Elektrobit Automotive GmbH
- * All rights exclusively reserved for Elektrobit Automotive GmbH,
- * unless expressly agreed to otherwise.
- *
- * \\remarks Please read ImportantNotes_DMATemplate.txt
- */
-
-/*==================[inclusions]============================================*/
-
-#include <Spi.h>          /* AUTOSAR SPI driver to include Ifx_SRC_SRCR */
-#include <Spi_UserCode.h> /* Own header file for macro definitions */
-
-/*==================[macros]================================================*/
-
-/*==================[type definitions]======================================*/
-
-/*==================[external function declarations]========================*/
-
-/*==================[internal function declarations]========================*/
-
-/*==================[external constants]====================================*/
-
-/*==================[internal constants]====================================*/
-
-/*==================[external data]=========================================*/
-
-/*==================[internal data]=========================================*/
-
-/*==================[external function definitions]=========================*/
-
-FUNC(void, SPI_APPL_CODE) Spi_InitDMAUsr(void)
-{
-  /* Note: If template matches to your need please change \'#if 1\' to #if 0\' */
-#if 1
-  /* QSPI RX and TX have to be mapped to DMA - not to interrupts. Infineon IRQ
-   * module is capable to map interrupt nodes to CPU0/CPU1/CPU2 interrupts or
-   * to DMA.
-   * This functionality have to be implemented in the user application as part
-   * of integration code with EB\'s Autocore OS or Safety OS and with AutoCore
-   * Generic.
-   *
-   *  Implementation hint:
-   *  Please adapt macros "QSPI_SCR_RX_PRIO" and "QSPI_SCR_TX_PRIO" to match
-   *  the configuration in your application.
-   *
-   *  FUNC(void, SPI_APPL_CODE) Spi_InitDMAUsr(void)
-   *  {
-   *    Ifx_SRC_SRCR txDMA, rxDMA;
-   *    txDMA.U = 0U;
-   *    rxDMA.U = 0U;
-   *
-   *    SRC_QSPI_QSPI2_TX.U = QSPI_SCR_CLR_MASK;
-   *    SRC_QSPI_QSPI2_RX.U = QSPI_SCR_CLR_MASK;
-   *
-   *    txDMA.B.TOS = QSPI_SCR_DMA_MODE;
-   *    rxDMA.B.TOS = QSPI_SCR_DMA_MODE;
-   *
-   *    txDMA.B.SRPN = QSPI_SCR_TX_PRIO;
-   *    rxDMA.B.SRPN = QSPI_SCR_RX_PRIO;
-   *
-   *    txDMA.B.SRE = QSPI_SCR_EN_SRE;
-   *    rxDMA.B.SRE = QSPI_SCR_EN_SRE;
-   *  
-   *    SRC_QSPI_QSPI2_TX.U = txDMA.U;
-   *    SRC_QSPI_QSPI2_RX.U = rxDMA.U;
-   *  }
-   */
-#else
-  Ifx_SRC_SRCR txDMA, rxDMA;
-  txDMA.U = 0U;
-  rxDMA.U = 0U;
-
-  /* Clear pending requests before DMA configuration */
-  SRC_QSPI_QSPI2_TX.U = QSPI_SCR_CLR_MASK;
-  SRC_QSPI_QSPI2_RX.U = QSPI_SCR_CLR_MASK;
-
-  /* Set Type of Service to \'DMA\' */
-  txDMA.B.TOS = QSPI_SCR_DMA_MODE;
-  rxDMA.B.TOS = QSPI_SCR_DMA_MODE;
-  /* Set Service Request Priority Number aka \'DMA channel\' */
-  txDMA.B.SRPN = QSPI_SCR_TX_PRIO;
-  rxDMA.B.SRPN = QSPI_SCR_RX_PRIO;
-  /* Service Request Enable bit */
-  txDMA.B.SRE = QSPI_SCR_EN_SRE;
-  rxDMA.B.SRE = QSPI_SCR_EN_SRE;
-  
-  /* Write to QSPI2 Service Request registers */
-  SRC_QSPI_QSPI2_TX.U = txDMA.U;
-  SRC_QSPI_QSPI2_RX.U = rxDMA.U;
-#endif
-}

-/**
- * \\file Spi_UserCode.c
- *
- * \\brief AUTOSAR MCAL templates
- *
- * This file contains a template implementation of an initialization
- * function to configure the Spi DMA transfer in asynchronous mode.
- *
- * \\par To be changed by user: yes
- *
- * \\author Elektrobit Automotive GmbH, 91058 Erlangen, Germany
- *
- * Copyright 2005 - 2016 Elektrobit Automotive GmbH
- * All rights exclusively reserved for Elektrobit Automotive GmbH,
- * unless expressly agreed to otherwise.
- *
- * \\remarks Please read ImportantNotes_DMATemplate.txt
- */
-
-/*==================[inclusions]============================================*/
-
-#include <Spi.h>          /* AUTOSAR SPI driver to include Ifx_SRC_SRCR */
-#include <Spi_UserCode.h> /* Own header file for macro definitions */
-
-/*==================[macros]================================================*/
-
-/*==================[type definitions]======================================*/
-
-/*==================[external function declarations]========================*/
-
-/*==================[internal function declarations]========================*/
-
-/*==================[external constants]====================================*/
-
-/*==================[internal constants]====================================*/
-
-/*==================[external data]=========================================*/
-
-/*==================[internal data]=========================================*/
-
-/*==================[external function definitions]=========================*/
-
-FUNC(void, SPI_APPL_CODE) Spi_InitDMAUsr(void)
-{
-  /* Note: If template matches to your need please change \'#if 1\' to #if 0\' */
-#if 1
-  /* QSPI RX and TX have to be mapped to DMA - not to interrupts. Infineon IRQ
-   * module is capable to map interrupt nodes to CPU0/CPU1/CPU2 interrupts or
-   * to DMA.
-   * This functionality have to be implemented in the user application as part
-   * of integration code with EB\'s Autocore OS or Safety OS and with AutoCore
-   * Generic.
-   *
-   *  Implementation hint:
-   *  Please adapt macros "QSPI_SCR_RX_PRIO" and "QSPI_SCR_TX_PRIO" to match
-   *  the configuration in your application.
-   *
-   *  FUNC(void, SPI_APPL_CODE) Spi_InitDMAUsr(void)
-   *  {
-   *    Ifx_SRC_SRCR txDMA, rxDMA;
-   *    txDMA.U = 0U;
-   *    rxDMA.U = 0U;
-   *
-   *    SRC_QSPI_QSPI2_TX.U = QSPI_SCR_CLR_MASK;
-   *    SRC_QSPI_QSPI2_RX.U = QSPI_SCR_CLR_MASK;
-   *
-   *    txDMA.B.TOS = QSPI_SCR_DMA_MODE;
-   *    rxDMA.B.TOS = QSPI_SCR_DMA_MODE;
-   *
-   *    txDMA.B.SRPN = QSPI_SCR_TX_PRIO;
-   *    rxDMA.B.SRPN = QSPI_SCR_RX_PRIO;
-   *
-   *    txDMA.B.SRE = QSPI_SCR_EN_SRE;
-   *    rxDMA.B.SRE = QSPI_SCR_EN_SRE;
-   *  
-   *    SRC_QSPI_QSPI2_TX.U = txDMA.U;
-   *    SRC_QSPI_QSPI2_RX.U = rxDMA.U;
-   *  }
-   */
-#else
-  Ifx_SRC_SRCR txDMA, rxDMA;
-  txDMA.U = 0U;
-  rxDMA.U = 0U;
-
-  /* Clear pending requests before DMA configuration */
-  SRC_QSPI_QSPI2_TX.U = QSPI_SCR_CLR_MASK;
-  SRC_QSPI_QSPI2_RX.U = QSPI_SCR_CLR_MASK;
-
-  /* Set Type of Service to \'DMA\' */
-  txDMA.B.TOS = QSPI_SCR_DMA_MODE;
-  rxDMA.B.TOS = QSPI_SCR_DMA_MODE;
-  /* Set Service Request Priority Number aka \'DMA channel\' */
-  txDMA.B.SRPN = QSPI_SCR_TX_PRIO;
-  rxDMA.B.SRPN = QSPI_SCR_RX_PRIO;
-  /* Service Request Enable bit */
-  txDMA.B.SRE = QSPI_SCR_EN_SRE;
-  rxDMA.B.SRE = QSPI_SCR_EN_SRE;
-  
-  /* Write to QSPI2 Service Request registers */
-  SRC_QSPI_QSPI2_TX.U = txDMA.U;
-  SRC_QSPI_QSPI2_RX.U = rxDMA.U;
-#endif
-}

-#ifndef SPI_USERCODE_H
-#define SPI_USERCODE_H
-
-/**
- * \\file Spi_UserCode.h
- *
- * \\brief AUTOSAR MCAL templates
- *
- * This file contains a template implementation of an initialization
- * function to configure the Spi DMA transfer in asynchronous mode.
- *
- * \\par To be changed by user: yes
- *
- * \\author Elektrobit Automotive GmbH, 91058 Erlangen, Germany
- *
- * Copyright 2005 - 2016 Elektrobit Automotive GmbH
- * All rights exclusively reserved for Elektrobit Automotive GmbH,
- * unless expressly agreed to otherwise.
- *
- * \\remarks Please read ImportantNotes_DMATemplate.txt
- */
-
-/*==================[inclusions]============================================*/
-#include <Std_Types.h>\t/* AUTOSAR standard types */
-
-/*==================[macros]================================================*/
-#ifdef QSPI_SCR_CLR_MASK
-#error QSPI_SCR_CLR_MASK already defined
-#endif
-/** \\brief Set CLRR to clear SRR bit and disable SRE bit */
-#define QSPI_SCR_CLR_MASK (0x02000000u)
-
-#ifdef QSPI_SCR_DMA_MODE
-#error QSPI_SCR_DMA_MODE already defined
-#endif
-/** \\brief Set ToS to DMA */
-#define QSPI_SCR_DMA_MODE (3u)
-
-#ifdef QSPI_SCR_EN_SRE
-#error QSPI_SCR_EN_SRE already defined
-#endif
-/** \\brief Bit to enable service request */
-#define QSPI_SCR_EN_SRE   (1u)
-
-/*-------------------------[Application specific]----------------------------*/
-/* User: Please change to your needs */
-
-#ifdef QSPI_SCR_RX_PRIO
-#error QSPI_SCR_RX_PRIO already defined
-#endif
-/** \\brief QSPI2RX to DMA channel mapping */
-#define QSPI_SCR_RX_PRIO  (4u)
-
-#ifdef QSPI_SCR_TX_PRIO
-#error QSPI_SCR_TX_PRIO already defined
-#endif
-/** \\brief QSPI2TX to DMA channel mapping */
-#define QSPI_SCR_TX_PRIO  (5u)
-
-/*==================[type definitions]======================================*/
-
-/*==================[external function declarations]========================*/
-
-/** \\brief User function to initialize DMA in SPI
- **
- ** \\return No return value. */
-extern FUNC(void, SPI_APPL_CODE) Spi_InitDMAUsr(void);
-
-/*==================[internal function declarations]========================*/
-
-/*==================[external constants]====================================*/
-
-/*==================[internal constants]====================================*/
-
-/*==================[external data]=========================================*/
-
-/*==================[internal data]=========================================*/
-
-/*==================[external function definitions]=========================*/
-
-/*==================[end of file]===========================================*/
-#endif /* #ifndef SPI_USERCODE_H */

-/**
- * \\file Spi_UserCode.h
- *
- * \\brief AUTOSAR MCAL templates

- * This file contains a template implementation of an initialization
- * function to configure the Spi DMA transfer in asynchronous mode.

- * \\par To be changed by user: yes

-#error QSPI_SCR_CLR_MASK already defined
-#endif

-#error QSPI_SCR_DMA_MODE already defined
-#endif

-#define QSPI_SCR_DMA_MODE (3u)
-
-#ifdef QSPI_SCR_EN_SRE
-#error QSPI_SCR_EN_SRE already defined
-#endif
-/** \\brief Bit to enable service request */
-#define QSPI_SCR_EN_SRE   (1u)
-
-/*-------------------------[Application specific]----------------------------*/
-/* User: Please change to your needs */
-
-#ifdef QSPI_SCR_RX_PRIO
-#error QSPI_SCR_RX_PRIO already defined
-#endif
-/** \\brief QSPI2RX to DMA channel mapping */
-#define QSPI_SCR_RX_PRIO  (4u)

-#ifdef QSPI_SCR_TX_PRIO
-#error QSPI_SCR_TX_PRIO already defined
-#endif

-/*==================[external function declarations]========================*/
-

- **
- ** \\return No return value. */

-/*==================[internal function declarations]========================*/

-/*==================[external constants]====================================*/

-def PPArxml(db, inputFolder, outputFolder):
-\tloadModules = []
-\tgenModule = []
-\ttresosinpfiles = []

-\t\tloadModules.append(\'-n \' + module)

-\t\t\tgenModule.append(\'-g \' + modConfig[\'PluginName\'])

-\t\t\t\tcontent = INP.read()

-\treturn

diff --git a/src/fw_cu/build/BSW_utils/createMakefileForVectorGeneratedFiles.py b/src/fw_cu/build/BSW_utils/createMakefileForVectorGeneratedFiles.py
new file mode 100644
index 000000000..2b40c7184
--- /dev/null
+++ b/src/fw_cu/build/BSW_utils/createMakefileForVectorGeneratedFiles.py
@@ -0,0 +1,69 @@
+import argparse
+import json
+import os
+import sys
+
+def createMakefileForVectorGeneratedFiles( jsonFile, artifactsRootDir ):
+
+\twith open( jsonFile ) as inputFileHandle:
+\t\tjson_db = json.load( inputFileHandle )
+
+\tlistOf_BSW_moduleNames = sorted( json_db[ \'BswModules\' ] )
+
+\tmakefilecontent = \'VECTOR_PROJECT_MODULES := {}\
\
\'.format( \' \'.join( listOf_BSW_moduleNames ) )
+
+\t# ATTENTION: Ideally, we shouldn\'t generate absolute path names into any of the artifacts of an
+\t# AUTOSAR project, but the build system is equipped to handle them correctly, so for now this
+\t# will be ok.
+\tmakefilecontent += \'CC_INCLUDE_PATH += \' + artifactsRootDir + \'\
\'
+\tmakefilecontent += \'CC_FILES_TO_BUILD += $(wildcard \' + artifactsRootDir + \'/*.c)\
\'
+\tmakefilecontent += \'ASM_FILES_TO_BUILD += $(wildcard \' + artifactsRootDir + \'/*.s)\
\'
+
+\tcomponentsSubDir = os.path.join( artifactsRootDir, \'Components\' )
+
+\tmakefilecontent += \'CC_INCLUDE_PATH += \' + componentsSubDir + \'\
\'
+\tmakefilecontent += \'CC_FILES_TO_BUILD += $(wildcard \' + componentsSubDir + \'/*.c)\
\'
+\tmakefilecontent += \'ASM_FILES_TO_BUILD += $(wildcard \' + componentsSubDir + \'/*.s)\
\'
+
+\tdirInWhichToCreateMakefile = os.path.join( artifactsRootDir, \'Make\' )
+
+\tif not os.path.isdir( dirInWhichToCreateMakefile ):
+\t\tos.makedirs( dirInWhichToCreateMakefile )
+
+\tmakefileToCreate = os.path.join( dirInWhichToCreateMakefile, \'Make_cfg.mak\' )
+
+\twith open( makefileToCreate, \'w\' ) as OUT:
+\t\tOUT.write( makefilecontent )
+
+\tprint( \'NOTE: Created makefile {0}.\'.format( makefileToCreate ) )
+
+if __name__ == \'__main__\':
+
+\tclass ArgumentParserError( Exception ): pass
+
+\tclass ThrowingArgumentParser( argparse.ArgumentParser ):
+\t\tdef error( self, message ):
+\t\t\traise ArgumentParserError( message )
+
+\t# Set up the command line parser.
+\tparser = ThrowingArgumentParser(
+\t\tdescription = \'BSW script to generate makefile for integration of Vector DaVinci AUTOSAR project in the build.\',
+\t\tusage = os.path.basename( __file__ ) + \' [-h] artifactsRootDir jsonFile\'
+\t)
+
+\tparser.add_argument( \'jsonFile\', type = str, help = \'BSW config file in json format\' )
+
+\tparser.add_argument( \'artifactsRootDir\', type = str, help = \'Path of directory in which Vector-generated artifacts reside\' )
+
+\ttry:
+\t\targs = parser.parse_args()
+\texcept ArgumentParserError as theError:
+\t\tprint( theError, file = sys.stderr )
+\t\tsys.exit( -1 )
+
+\tcreateMakefileForVectorGeneratedFiles(
+\t\tos.path.abspath( args.jsonFile ),
+\t\tos.path.abspath( args.artifactsRootDir )
+\t)
+
+\tsys.exit( 0 )
diff --git a/src/fw_cu/build/BSW_utils/deleteMemMapHeaders.pl b/src/fw_cu/build/BSW_utils/deleteMemMapHeaders.pl
new file mode 100644
index 000000000..d9da7858b
--- /dev/null
+++ b/src/fw_cu/build/BSW_utils/deleteMemMapHeaders.pl
@@ -0,0 +1,159 @@
+use strict;
+use warnings FATAL => \'all\';
+
+# standard Perl library imports
+use Carp::Always;
+use Carp::Assert;
+use File::Basename;
+use Getopt::Long;
+
+# tools/cm imports
+use Common;
+use DebugLogger;
+use DurationPrinter;
+use FileUtil;
+use StringFuncs;
+
+use constant FALSE => 0;
+use constant TRUE => ! FALSE;
+
+sub getUsageString()
+{
+\treturn "\
\
" .
+\t\t"Description:\
\
" .
+\t\t"\\t" . "This script is used to delete any Vector-generated mem map C header files from the\
" .
+\t\t"\\t" . "artifact directory tree of a Vector DaVinci AUTOSAR project (as those may interfere\
" .
+\t\t"\\t" . "with compilation).\
" .
+\t\t"\
" .
+\t\t"Usage:\
\
" .
+\t\t"\\t" . \'perl \' . File::Basename::basename( $0 ) . " <artifactRootDir> <regex_0 .. regex_N-1>\
" .
+\t\t"\\t\\t" . "[--dry_run] [--debug[=modules]] [--help]\
" .
+\t\t"\\t\\t" . "\
" .
+\t\t"\\t" . "positional (mandatory) args:\
" .
+\t\t"\\t\\t" . "artifactRootDir                             Absolute path of artifact directory tree from which to delete files.\
" .
+\t\t"\\t\\t" . "regex_0 .. regex_N-1                        One or more regexes to match the names of the files to delete.\
" .
+\t\t"\\t\\t" . "\
" .
+\t\t"\\t" . "optional args:\
" .
+\t\t"\\t\\t" . "--debug[=modules]                           If specified, print additional debug output to stdout.\
" .
+\t\t"\\t\\t" . "--dry_run                                   Dry-run. Do not delete anything; just print the paths of\
" .
+\t\t"\\t\\t" . "                                            the files that would be deleted if this were the real thing.\
" .
+\t\t"\\t\\t" . "--help                                      Print help screen and exit.\
\
" .
+\t\t"Exit codes:\
\
" .
+\t\t"\\t" . "0  :      No problems were encountered.\
" .
+\t\t"\\t" . "<>0:      At least one error occurred.\
\
\
\
";
+}
+
+sub __mainImpl($)
+{
+\tmy ( $refToScriptArgsArray ) = @_;
+
+\t# Extract keyword args (optional) first because GetOptions() will remove any options it
+\t# recognizes from the command line.
+\tmy $debug;
+\tmy $dry_run;
+\tmy $help = \'\';
+
+\tGetopt::Long::GetOptionsFromArray(
+\t\t$refToScriptArgsArray,
+\t\t\'debug:s\' => \\$debug,
+\t\t\'dry_run\' => \\$dry_run,
+\t\t\'help\'    => \\$help
+\t) or die "ERROR: Failed to parse options!\
\
" . getUsageString();
+
+\tif ( $help )
+\t{
+\t\tprint( getUsageString() );
+\t\treturn;
+\t}
+
+\tif ( @$refToScriptArgsArray < 2 )
+\t{
+\t\tdie "ERROR: Not enough arguments!\
\
" . getUsageString();
+\t}
+
+\tmy $dbgLogger = DebugLogger::createFromCommandLineArg( $debug );
+
+\t# RAII guard to automatically print timing info on leaving this function.
+\tmy $timePrinter = DurationPrinter->new(
+\t\t__FILE__,
+\t\tDurationPrinter::SUPPRESS_PRINTOUT_NEVER,
+\t\tTRUE
+\t);
+
+\tmy $artifactRootDir = FileUtil::simplifyPath( shift( @$refToScriptArgsArray ) );
+\tmy @fileNameRegexes = map { StringFuncs::trim( $_ ) } @$refToScriptArgsArray;
+
+\tassert( $artifactRootDir ne \'\' );
+\tassert( StringFuncs::noneNull( @fileNameRegexes ) );
+
+\t__deleteMemMapHeaders( $artifactRootDir, $dry_run, $dbgLogger, @fileNameRegexes );
+}
+
+sub __deleteMemMapHeaders($$$@)
+{
+\tmy ( $artifactRootDir, $dry_run, $dbgLogger, @fileNameRegexes ) = @_;
+
+\t# ATTENTION: Need to make a copy here to preserve the original. Reason: the map call below
+\t# modifies the input list ... afterwards it will contain at least one undef entry.
+\tmy @copyOfRegexes = @fileNameRegexes;
+
+\tassert( StringFuncs::noneNull( @copyOfRegexes ) );
+
+\tmy @toDelete = map {
+\t\tFileUtil::catalogFiles(
+\t\t\t$artifactRootDir,
+\t\t\tFileUtil::FILE_NAMES_CASE_SENSITIVE ? qr/$_/ : qr/$_/i,
+\t\t\t$dbgLogger
+\t\t);
+\t} @copyOfRegexes;
+
+\tassert( StringFuncs::noneNull( @fileNameRegexes ) );
+
+\tprintf(
+\t\t"NOTE: The %u file name regexes %s matched %u files under \\"%s\\:\
\
\\t%s\
\
",
+\t\tscalar( @fileNameRegexes ),
+\t\tjoin( \', \', map { sprintf( \'{%s}\', $_ ) } @fileNameRegexes ),
+\t\tscalar( @toDelete ),
+\t\t$artifactRootDir,
+\t\tjoin( "\
\\t", @toDelete )
+\t);
+
+\tforeach my $deleteThisFile ( @toDelete )
+\t{
+\t\tif ( $dry_run )
+\t\t{
+\t\t\tprintf( "NOTE: (--dry_run) Would delete \\"%s\\".\
", $deleteThisFile );
+\t\t}
+\t\telse
+\t\t{
+\t\t\tFileUtil::deleteElement( $deleteThisFile, $dbgLogger );
+\t\t}
+\t}
+}
+
+sub main($)
+{
+\tmy ( $refToScriptArgsArray ) = @_;
+
+\teval {
+\t\t__mainImpl( $refToScriptArgsArray );
+\t\t1;
+\t} or do {
+
+\t\tmy $argString = Common::printArgs( \\@ARGV );
+
+\t\tprintf(
+\t\t\t"\
ERROR: <%s> An exception was caught while while deleting Vector-generated mem " .
+\t\t\t\t"map C header files.\
\
%s\
\
%s\
\
",
+\t\t\tFileUtil::simplifyPath( __FILE__ ),
+\t\t\t$@,
+\t\t\t$argString
+\t\t);
+
+\t\treturn 1;
+\t};
+
+\treturn 0;
+}
+
+exit( main( [ @ARGV ] ) );
diff --git a/src/fw_cu/build/BSW_utils/runTresosGeneration.py b/src/fw_cu/build/BSW_utils/runTresosGeneration.py
new file mode 100644
index 000000000..a9fe87709
--- /dev/null
+++ b/src/fw_cu/build/BSW_utils/runTresosGeneration.py
@@ -0,0 +1,227 @@
+import argparse
+import json
+import os
+import subprocess
+import sys
+
+ARXML_SCHEMA_VERSION = \'4.2.2\'
+ARXML_SCHEMA_VERSION_SUFFIX = \'@asc:\' + ARXML_SCHEMA_VERSION
+
+class TresosError( Exception ):
+\t"""Exception class for tresos-execution errors."""
+\tpass
+
+def runTresosGeneration(
+\tjsonFile,
+\ttresosCmdBatchFile,
+\ttresosProjectRootDir,
+\tartifactsRootDir,
+\tread_ARXML_filesFromHere,
+\tplace_ARXML_filesHere,
+\tcomponentRootPath
+):
+
+\ttresosCommandList = [
+\t\ttresosCmdBatchFile,
+
+\t\t\'-DValidate=true\',
+
+\t\t## @todo Ideally, these guys could be dynamically queried from the build system. The target
+\t\t## hardware is already encoded in the build config, so this is kind of redundant. Sadly, at
+\t\t## this time, no suitable mechanism exists.
+\t\t\'-Dtarget=TRICORE\',
+\t\t\'-Dderivate=TC37XT\',
+
+\t\t\'legacy\',
+
+\t\t\'generate\'
+\t]
+
+\twith open( jsonFile ) as inputFileHandle:
+\t\tjson_db = json.load( inputFileHandle )
+
+\ttresosCommandList += preprocess_ARXML( json_db, read_ARXML_filesFromHere, place_ARXML_filesHere )
+
+\ttresosCommandList += getAdditionalTresosArgs( tresosProjectRootDir )
+
+\ttresosCommandList += [ \'-o\', artifactsRootDir ]
+
+\tprint( \'NOTE: Running command:\
\
\\t\', \'\
\\t\'.join( tresosCommandList ), \'\
\', sep = \'\' )
+
+\ttry:
+\t\tsubprocess.check_output( tresosCommandList, universal_newlines = True, shell = True )
+\texcept Exception as theError:
+\t\traise TresosError( \'Failed to execute "{}"! Reason:\
\
\\t{}\
\
\'.format( tresosCmdBatchFile, theError ) )
+
+\t# Normally, tresos itself generates the makefile via which to integrate the AUTOSAR project\'s
+\t# artifacts in the build. In this case, this tresos feature has been disabled, so we will now
+\t# create this makefile ourselves.
+\tcreateMakefileForTresosProjectIntegration( json_db, artifactsRootDir, componentRootPath )
+
+def getAdditionalTresosArgs( tresosProjectRootDir ):
+
+\tadditionalTresosArgs = [
+\t\t\'-n\', \'Base\',
+\t\t\'-n\', \'Compiler\',
+\t\t\'-g\', \'Base_TS_TxDxM5I0R0\',
+\t\t\'-g\', \'Compiler_TS_TxDxM1I0R0\'
+\t]
+
+\tadditionalArxmlSpecs = [
+\t\tos.path.join( tresosProjectRootDir, \'config\', \'OutputArxml\', \'Base.arxml\' ) + ARXML_SCHEMA_VERSION_SUFFIX,
+\t\tos.path.join( tresosProjectRootDir, \'config\', \'OutputArxml\', \'Compiler.arxml\' ) + ARXML_SCHEMA_VERSION_SUFFIX,
+\t]
+
+\treturn additionalTresosArgs + additionalArxmlSpecs
+
+def preprocess_ARXML( json_db, read_ARXML_filesFromHere, place_ARXML_filesHere ):
+
+\tif not os.path.isdir( place_ARXML_filesHere ):
+\t\tos.makedirs( place_ARXML_filesHere )
+
+\tloadModules = []
+\tgenModule = []
+\ttresosInputFileSpecs = []
+
+\tfor module, modConfig in json_db[ \'McalModules\' ].items():
+
+\t\tloadModules.append( \'-n\' )
+\t\tloadModules.append( module )
+
+\t\tif modConfig[ \'Generate\' ]:
+\t\t\tgenModule.append( \'-g\' )
+\t\t\tgenModule.append( modConfig[ \'PluginName\' ] )
+
+\t\tinputFileBasename = modConfig[ \'InputArxml\' ]
+
+\t\tinputfile = os.path.join( read_ARXML_filesFromHere, inputFileBasename )
+
+\t\ttry:
+\t\t\twith open( inputfile ) as inputFileHandle:
+\t\t\t\tcontent = inputFileHandle.read()
+
+\t\t\t\tfor text1, text2 in modConfig[ \'FindAndReplace\' ]:
+\t\t\t\t\tcontent = content.replace( text1, text2 )
+
+\t\texcept:
+\t\t\tprint( \'WARNING: Could not find input arxml file "{0}" for module {1}!\'.format( inputfile, module ) )
+\t\t\tcontinue
+
+\t\toutputfile = os.path.join( place_ARXML_filesHere, inputFileBasename )
+
+\t\tprint( \'NOTE: Writing file {0} for module {1} ...\'.format( outputfile, module ) )
+
+\t\twith open( outputfile, \'w\' ) as outputFileHandle:
+\t\t\toutputFileHandle.write( content )
+
+\t\ttresosInputFileSpecs.append( outputfile + ARXML_SCHEMA_VERSION_SUFFIX )
+
+\treturn loadModules + genModule + tresosInputFileSpecs
+
+def createMakefileForTresosProjectIntegration( json_db, artifactsRootDir, componentRootPath ):
+
+\tmcalKeysDict = json_db[ \'McalModules\' ]
+
+\tlistOfModuleNames = list( mcalKeysDict.keys() )
+
+\tmoduleMakeContent = \'\'
+
+\tfor moduleName in sorted( listOfModuleNames ):
+\t\tsubdictForThisModule = mcalKeysDict[ moduleName ]
+
+\t\tpluginName = subdictForThisModule[ \'PluginName\' ]
+\t\tpluginPath = subdictForThisModule[ \'PluginPath\' ]
+
+\t\tvariant = \'_\'.join( pluginName.split( \'_\' )[ 1 : ] )
+
+\t\tmoduleMakeContent += \'{0}_VARIANT := {1}\
\'.format( moduleName, variant )
+
+\t\tif pluginPath != \'\':
+\t\t\tabsolutePluginPath = os.path.join( componentRootPath, pluginPath )
+
+\t\t\tmoduleMakeContent += \'{0}_CORE_PATH := {1}\
\'.format( moduleName, absolutePluginPath )
+
+\t\tif ( len( pluginName.split( \'_\' ) ) == 2 ):
+\t\t\tmoduleMakeContent += \'McalExt_{}_USED := true\
\'.format( moduleName )
+
+\t## @todo TEMPORARY HACK - either remove these or move them to BSW_Config.json
+\tlistOfModuleNames.append( \'Base\' )
+\tlistOfModuleNames.append( \'Compiler\' )
+
+\tmoduleMakeContent += \'{0}_VARIANT := {1}\
{0}_CORE_PATH := {2}\
\'.format(
+\t\t\'Base\',
+\t\t\'TS_TxDxM5I0R0\',
+\t\tos.path.join( componentRootPath, \'Components/Extern/AutoCore/eclipse/plugins/Base_TS_TxDxM5I0R0\' )
+\t)
+
+\tmoduleMakeContent += \'{0}_VARIANT := {1}\
{0}_CORE_PATH := {2}\
\'.format(
+\t\t\'Compiler\',
+\t\t\'TS_TxDxM1I0R0\',
+\t\tos.path.join( componentRootPath, \'Components/Extern/AutoCore/eclipse/plugins/Compiler_TS_TxDxM1I0R0\' )
+\t)
+\t## TEMPORARY HACK ENDS HERE
+
+\tmakefilecontent = \'TARGET := TRICORE\
\'
+\tmakefilecontent += \'DERIVATE := TC37XT\
\'
+\tmakefilecontent += \'OS_VENDOR := EB\
\
\'
+\tmakefilecontent += \'PROJECT_MODULES := {}\
\
\'.format( \' \'.join( listOfModuleNames ) )
+
+\tmakefilecontent += moduleMakeContent
+
+\tdirInWhichToCreateMakefile = os.path.join( artifactsRootDir, \'make\' )
+
+\tif not os.path.isdir( dirInWhichToCreateMakefile ):
+\t\tos.makedirs( dirInWhichToCreateMakefile )
+
+\tmakefileToCreate = os.path.join( dirInWhichToCreateMakefile, \'Make_cfg.mak\' )
+
+\twith open( makefileToCreate, \'w\' ) as OUT:
+\t\tOUT.write( makefilecontent )
+
+\tprint( \'NOTE: Created makefile {0}.\'.format( makefileToCreate ) )
+
+if __name__ == \'__main__\':
+
+\tclass ArgumentParserError( Exception ): pass
+
+\tclass ThrowingArgumentParser( argparse.ArgumentParser ):
+\t\tdef error( self, message ):
+\t\t\traise ArgumentParserError( message )
+
+\t# Set up the command line parser.
+\tparser = ThrowingArgumentParser(
+\t\tdescription = \'BSW script to preprocess ARXML files for Elektrobit tresos build and then run the tresos build.\',
+\t\tusage = os.path.basename( __file__ ) + \' [-h] tresosCmdBatchFile tresosProjectRootDir artifactsRootDir jsonFile read_ARXML_filesFromHere place_ARXML_filesHere componentRootPath\'
+\t)
+
+\tparser.add_argument( \'tresosCmdBatchFile\', type = str, help = \'Path of tresos CMD batch file to run\' )
+
+\tparser.add_argument( \'tresosProjectRootDir\', type = str, help = \'Path of tresos project root directory\' )
+
+\tparser.add_argument( \'artifactsRootDir\', type = str, help = \'Path of directory into which to generate tresos artifacts\' )
+
+\tparser.add_argument( \'jsonFile\', type = str, help = \'BSW config file in json format\' )
+
+\tparser.add_argument( \'read_ARXML_filesFromHere\', type = str, help = \'Path of directory from which to read ARXML files to preprocess\' )
+
+\tparser.add_argument( \'place_ARXML_filesHere\', type = str, help = \'Path of directory in which to store preprocessed ARXML files\' )
+
+\tparser.add_argument( \'componentRootPath\', type = str, help = \'Path of component root directory (e.g. D:\\\\repo\\\\100kW\\\\src\\\\fw_cu).\' )
+
+\ttry:
+\t\targs = parser.parse_args()
+\texcept ArgumentParserError as theError:
+\t\tprint( theError, file = sys.stderr )
+\t\tsys.exit( -1 )
+
+\trunTresosGeneration(
+\t\tos.path.abspath( args.jsonFile ),
+\t\tos.path.abspath( args.tresosCmdBatchFile ),
+\t\tos.path.abspath( args.tresosProjectRootDir ),
+\t\tos.path.abspath( args.artifactsRootDir ),
+\t\tos.path.abspath( args.read_ARXML_filesFromHere ),
+\t\tos.path.abspath( args.place_ARXML_filesHere ),
+\t\tos.path.abspath( args.componentRootPath )
+\t)
+
+\tsys.exit( 0 )
diff --git a/src/fw_cu/build/BuildEnvOEM/OEM-BE-README.txt b/src/fw_cu/build/BuildEnvOEM/OEM-BE-README.txt
deleted file mode 100644
index d63d1d120..000000000
--- a/src/fw_cu/build/BuildEnvOEM/OEM-BE-README.txt
+++ /dev/null
@@ -1,51 +0,0 @@
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-Installation
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-
-Extract the .zip to a directory of your choice (named in this file: %INSTALL_DIRECTORY%).
-You should see 2 directories in your directory:
-    ec_baic
-    oem_prerel
-
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-Build
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-
-- To use your own Perl install, set the PERL environment variable to point to your perl.exe.
-  If you do not define this environment variable, the Perl interpreter is expected at
-  %INSTALL_DIRECTORY%\\ec_baic\\bin\\perl\\bin\\perl.exe.
-
-- To use your own Tasking compiler / linker install, set the TOOLPATH_COMPILER environment variable to
-  point to your Tasking root directory (should contain the ctc, etc, cmcs ... sub directories).
-
-- Open a CMD window.
-
-- Change directory to %INSTALL_DIRECTORY%\\ec_baic\\src\\fw_cu\\build.
-
-- Enter the following command:
-    .\\make_fw_cu.cmd --verbose --all --link_oem_prerel
-
-- Be sure never to use the --rebuild_all, --rebuild or --clean options to make_fw_cu.cmd
-  as that would delete essential delivery files that cannot be rebuilt using this OEM
-  build environment!
-
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-Additional hints to proceed if the build does not work
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-
-In %INSTALL_DIRECTORY%\\ec_baic\\src\\fw_cu\\build\\ProjectConfig.xml, set the variable
-LM_LICENSE_FILE_VW to your license server. This is needed for the Tasking compiler /
-linker.
-
-NOTE that presently you may only have A2L files in %INSTALL_DIRECTORY%\\ec_baic\\src\\fw_cu\\Components\\Extern\\OEM\\ActvDampg.
-Other directories are not yet supported (but will be in future releases).
-
-
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-Replacing an existing VW software component (SWC)
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-
-- Add the source code to be compiled in %INSTALL_DIRECTORY%\\ec_baic\\src\\fw_cu\\Components\\Extern\\OEM\\<feature_name>.
-
-- Replace the A2L used by the SWC in %INSTALL_DIRECTORY%\\ec_baic\\src\\fw_cu\\Components\\Extern\\OEM\\<feature_name>.
-
diff --git a/src/fw_cu/build/ComponentConfig.xml b/src/fw_cu/build/ComponentConfig.xml
index 6d5679d27..00892824d 100644
--- a/src/fw_cu/build/ComponentConfig.xml
+++ b/src/fw_cu/build/ComponentConfig.xml
@@ -1,155 +1,562 @@
-<?xml version="1.0"?>
-<project xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
+<component>
 \t<AUTOSAR>
-\t\t<!-- If the OEM-BE should merely contain AUTOSAR build results but not any AUTOSAR input
-\t\tfiles, set this to false.
-\t\tIf the OEM-BE should include any AUTOSAR input files so that the customer can modify the
-\t\tAUTOSAR stuff, set this to true.
-\t\tIf the component does not have an OEM-BE, the value of this element is irrelevant.
-\t\t-->
-\t\t<!-- List of all our AUTOSAR projects. The first project in this list is the main project. -->
-\t\t<!-- List of any plugins to exclude from the build. -->
-\t\t<!-- The directory in which the Eclipse IDE is located. -->
-\t\t<!-- The root directory in which all projects reside. -->
-\t\t<archive disabled="true">
-\t\t\t<!-- To verify whether an AUTOSAR archive is up-to-date, the build environment must check
-\t\t\twhether any of the config files involved in the build have changed since the archive
-\t\t\twas built. Use one or more "include" tags to specify a white-space separated list of files
-\t\t\tand directories that must be included in this check in addition to the Tresos directory
-\t\t\titself.
-
-\t\t\tYou may also exclude certain paths by specifying them in an "exclude" tag. If you do
-\t\t\tspecify an exclude, there must be a matching include, i.e. one that is a parent directory of
-\t\t\tthe exclude. -->
-\t\t\t<additional_OTS_configFilesToWatch>
-\t\t\t\t<exclude>
-\t\t\t\t\t$(TOOLS_OTS)/tresos/demos
-\t\t\t\t</exclude>
-\t\t\t</additional_OTS_configFilesToWatch>
-\t\t\t<location>
-\t\t\t\t$(SHARED_AUTOSAR_ARCHIVE_DIR)
-\t\t\t</location>
+
+\t\t<toolChainInstances>
+
+\t\t\t<!-- Definition of the Elektrobit Tresos Studio tool chain used to generate at least one of
+\t\t\tthe AUTOSAR projects in this component.
+
+\t\t\tThe "name" attribute is the name of this particular instance and can be freely chosen (but
+\t\t\tmust be unique across all "toolChainInstance" elements). The value of this attribute is
+\t\t\treferenced via the "toolChainInstance" attribute of any "workspace" elements that make use
+\t\t\tof this particular tool chain.
+
+\t\t\tThe "type" attribute selects the vendor/product for this tool chain instance to determine
+\t\t\tthe general behavior of this instance. There must be a matching
+\t\t\tComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::VendorSpecific::* module for this selection to be
+\t\t\tsupported. -->
+\t\t\t<toolChainInstance name="EB_Tresos_default" type="ElektrobitTresos">
+
+\t\t\t\t<!-- Root directory of the tool. Referenceable via the automatic $(TOOL_CHAIN_ROOT)
+\t\t\t\tsymbol in the buildStep elements of any project that uses this tool chain. -->
+\t\t\t\t<rootDir>$(TOOLS_OTS)/tresos</rootDir>
+
+\t\t\t\t<!-- Workspaces are directories that serve as containers for AUTOSAR projects using
+\t\t\t\tthe same tool chain instance. Every workspace must contain 1 or more AUTOSAR
+\t\t\t\tprojects, but all contained projects must use the exaxt same tool chain instance.
+\t\t\t\tThe value configured here is referenceable via the automatic $(WORKSPACE_DIR) symbol
+\t\t\t\tin all projects that use this particular tool chain instance.
+
+\t\t\t\tNOTE: Each project\'s root directory path is obtained automatically by concatenating
+\t\t\t\tthe project\'s name to the workspace directory path of the associated tool chain
+\t\t\t\tinstance. -->
+\t\t\t\t<workspaceDir>$(COMPONENT_ROOT)/workspace/Tresos/</workspaceDir>
+
+\t\t\t\t<!-- This optional element allows defining additional locations in which plugins can
+\t\t\t\tbe placed. -->
+\t\t\t\t<additionalPlugins>
+\t\t\t\t\t<additionalPluginRoot>$(SOURCE_CODE_ROOT)/Extern/AutoCore</additionalPluginRoot>
+\t\t\t\t</additionalPlugins>
+
+\t\t\t\t<!-- This section allows defining additional reusable symbols on top of the ones that
+\t\t\t\tare always set for each AUTOSAR tool chain. -->
+\t\t\t\t<userDefinedSymbols>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>TRESOS_CMD_BATCH_FILE</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>$(TOOL_CHAIN_ROOT)/bin/tresos_cmd.bat</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t</userDefinedSymbols>
+
+\t\t\t\t<!-- To verify whether an AUTOSAR archive is up-to-date, the build system must
+\t\t\t\tcheck whether any of the config files involved in the build have changed since the
+\t\t\t\tarchive was built. "Config files", in this context, includes any files the build tool
+\t\t\t\titself consists of. By default, this is assumed to be any files that exist in the
+\t\t\t\tdirectory tree specified in the rootDir element.
+
+\t\t\t\tThis node provides the option to exclude from that check any files and directories
+\t\t\t\tthat you know for sure cannot impact the build. Excluding unnecessary baggage will
+\t\t\t\tspeed up the file hash check.
+\t\t\t\tPath names must be relative to $(TOOL_CHAIN_ROOT), i.e. the path configured in the
+\t\t\t\trootDir node. -->
+\t\t\t\t<excludeFromInputManifest>
+\t\t\t\t\t<path>demos</path>
+\t\t\t\t</excludeFromInputManifest>
+
+\t\t\t\t<setupSteps>
+\t\t\t\t</setupSteps>
+
+\t\t\t</toolChainInstance>
+
+\t\t\t<!-- This instance of Vector DaVinci is used to generate the BSW project. -->
+\t\t\t<toolChainInstance name="Vector_DaVinciConfigurator_R25" type="VectorDaVinci">
+
+\t\t\t\t<rootDir>$(TOOLS_OTS)/Vector_DaVinciConfigurator_R25</rootDir>
+
+\t\t\t\t<workspaceDir>$(COMPONENT_ROOT)/workspace/DaVinci_R25</workspaceDir>
+
+\t\t\t\t<additionalPlugins>
+\t\t\t\t\t<additionalPluginRoot>$(SOURCE_CODE_ROOT)/Extern/Vector_CoreComponents</additionalPluginRoot>
+\t\t\t\t</additionalPlugins>
+
+\t\t\t\t<userDefinedSymbols>
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>VECTOR_GENERATOR_TOOL</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>$(TOOL_CHAIN_ROOT)/DaVinciConfigurator/Core/DVCfgCmd.exe</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>DEM_A2L_GENERATOR</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>$(TOOL_CHAIN_ROOT)/Misc/Diag_A2lGen/Application/Diag_A2lGen.exe</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>COMPONENTS_FOLDER</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>$(TOOL_CHAIN_ROOT)/Components</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t</userDefinedSymbols>
+
+\t\t\t\t<excludeFromInputManifest>
+\t\t\t\t</excludeFromInputManifest>
+
+\t\t\t\t<setupSteps>
+\t\t\t\t</setupSteps>
+
+\t\t\t</toolChainInstance>
+
+\t\t\t<!-- This additional instance of Vector DaVinci is used to generate the OS project.
+\t\t\tApparently this requires a different version of Vector DaVinci than is used for the
+\t\t\tBSW project. -->
+\t\t\t<toolChainInstance name="Vector_DaVinciConfigurator_Os" type="VectorDaVinci">
+
+\t\t\t\t<rootDir>$(TOOLS_OTS)/Vector_DaVinciConfigurator_Os</rootDir>
+
+\t\t\t\t<workspaceDir>$(COMPONENT_ROOT)/workspace/DaVinci_OS</workspaceDir>
+
+\t\t\t\t<additionalPlugins>
+\t\t\t\t\t<additionalPluginRoot>$(SOURCE_CODE_ROOT)/Extern/Vector_CoreComponents</additionalPluginRoot>
+\t\t\t\t</additionalPlugins>
+
+\t\t\t\t<userDefinedSymbols>
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>VECTOR_GENERATOR_TOOL</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>$(TOOL_CHAIN_ROOT)/DaVinciConfigurator/Core/DVCfgCmd.exe</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>COMPONENTS_FOLDER</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>$(TOOL_CHAIN_ROOT)/Components</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>CHECK_AND_REGISTER_COM_DLL</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>$(DEFAULT_BUILD_ROOT)/RegisterAndCheckDll.ps1</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>EXTERNAL_COMPONENTS</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>$(TOOL_CHAIN_ROOT)/DaVinciConfigurator/Core/ExternalComponents</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t</userDefinedSymbols>
+
+\t\t\t\t<excludeFromInputManifest>
+\t\t\t\t</excludeFromInputManifest>
+
+\t\t\t\t<!-- For this particular tool chain instance, special one-time setup is necessary.
+\t\t\t\tA bunch of COM DLLs need to be registered with the system (unless this has already
+\t\t\t\tbeen done). Note that doing so requires elevated permissions. -->
+\t\t\t\t<setupSteps>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<setupStep>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<executor>powershell</executor>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<args>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="string">-file</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(CHECK_AND_REGISTER_COM_DLL)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(EXTERNAL_COMPONENTS)/MultiOSMgr.dll</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t</args>
+\t\t\t\t\t</setupStep>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<setupStep>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<executor>powershell</executor>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<args>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="string">-file</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(CHECK_AND_REGISTER_COM_DLL)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(EXTERNAL_COMPONENTS)/DVSharedComponentProxy.dll</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t</args>
+\t\t\t\t\t</setupStep>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<setupStep>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<executor>powershell</executor>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<args>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="string">-file</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(CHECK_AND_REGISTER_COM_DLL)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(EXTERNAL_COMPONENTS)/DVSharedComponentProxy64.dll</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t</args>
+\t\t\t\t\t</setupStep>
+
+\t\t\t\t</setupSteps>
+
+\t\t\t</toolChainInstance>
+
+\t\t</toolChainInstances>
+
+\t\t<archive disabled="false">
+\t\t\t<!-- The primary location from which to retrieve existing archives and to which to
+\t\t\tdeploy newly built ones. Usually a network share.
+
+\t\t\tNOTE that, as an optimization, a secondary (cached) storage location will be set up in a
+\t\t\tsuitable temporary directory in your local file system. The system will preferentially
+\t\t\tsearch this local cache and only resort to searching the shared location if it failed
+\t\t\tto find a matching archive in the local cache. -->
+\t\t\t<location>$(SHARED_AUTOSAR_ARCHIVE_DIR)</location>
 \t\t</archive>
-\t\t<buildIn_OEM_BE>
-\t\t\tfalse
-\t\t</buildIn_OEM_BE>
-\t\t<EclipseRootDir>
-\t\t\t$(TOOLS_OTS)/eclipse
-\t\t</EclipseRootDir>
-\t\t<excludePlugins/>
+
+\t\t<!-- List of all our AUTOSAR projects.
+
+\t\tATTENTION: The AUTOSAR projects listed here are built (i.e. their artifacts are generated)
+\t\tin no particular order! The buildSteps configurations of your AUTOSAR projects must not
+\t\thave any dependencies towards the artifacts generated by other AUTOSAR projects, because
+\t\tthere is no guarantee that the builds of those projects will already have been run by that
+\t\ttime! -->
 \t\t<projects>
-\t\t\t<project generateDisabled="false" name="nextgen">
+
+\t\t\t<!-- This particular project is generated via the toolChainInstance element whose
+\t\t\t"name" attribute matches the value of this element\'s "toolChainInstance" attribute.
+
+\t\t\tThe base directory of the project is determined by concatenating the project\'s name to
+\t\t\tthe workspace directory of the tool chain instance referenced by the project. The path
+\t\t\tis accessible via the $(PROJECT_ROOT) variable in any buildStep elements of this
+\t\t\tproject.
+
+\t\t\tNOTE that, depending on the selected variant to build and the tool chain used, the actual
+\t\t\tproject root directory may differ from the base root directory. -->
+\t\t\t<project name="nextgen" toolChainInstance="EB_Tresos_default">
+
+\t\t\t\t<!-- Directory into which to place any artifacts generated by the build of this
+\t\t\t\tAUTOSAR project. Path must be relative to $(PROJECT_ROOT).
+
+\t\t\t\tThe resulting path is accessible via the $(ARTIFACTS_ROOT) variable. -->
+\t\t\t\t<artifactRootDir>output/generated</artifactRootDir>
+
+\t\t\t\t<!-- This section allows defining additional reusable symbols on top of the ones that
+\t\t\t\tare always set for each AUTOSAR project. -->
+\t\t\t\t<userDefinedSymbols>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>PYTHON_EXE</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>$(TOOLS_OTS)/python/64bit/python-3.4.3.amd64/python.exe</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>RUN_TRESOS_GENERATION_SCRIPT</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>$(DEFAULT_BUILD_ROOT)/BSW_utils/runTresosGeneration.py</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t</userDefinedSymbols>
+
+\t\t\t\t<!-- When checking whether an AUTOSAR archive is up-to-date, normally only the config
+\t\t\t\tfiles in the AUTOSAR project as well as the plugins and the tool installation folder
+\t\t\t\tare taken into consideration. However, since generating the artifacts for this
+\t\t\t\tparticular AUTOSAR project also involves some hand-rolled tool scripts, it is
+\t\t\t\tnecessary to include these in the check. -->
+\t\t\t\t<additionalInputs>
+\t\t\t\t\t<additionalInput>$(RUN_TRESOS_GENERATION_SCRIPT)</additionalInput>
+\t\t\t\t</additionalInputs>
+
 \t\t\t\t<!-- This element can be used to inform the build system about inputs that are
 \t\t\t\tmodified by the AUTOSAR build. Normally, an AUTOSAR build should not modify its own
 \t\t\t\tinputs, but there may be some edge cases where that legitimately happens. If so,
 \t\t\t\tany such inputs must be specified here (or the build will fail).
-\t\t\t\tPath names must be relative to the $(WORKSPACE_ROOT) path. -->
-\t\t\t\t<!-- This is a whitespace-separated list of all generator types, in the exact order
-\t\t\t\tin which they should be run.
-
-\t\t\t\tATTENTION: The generatorTypes tag now supports a new, special notation.
-\t\t\t\tPreviously, entries could only be single words. Now you may also enter groups of words
-\t\t\t\tenclosed in double-quotes. If this notation is used, the first word in the group is
-\t\t\t\tunderstood to be the name of a custom action (such as autoconfigure, which at this point is
-\t\t\t\tthe only supported custom action). The 2nd, 3rd, etc. words will be passed as additional
-\t\t\t\targuments to the generator command, separated from the generator name by the automatically
-\t\t\t\tinserted project name. I.e, if you write "autoconfigure A2LGenerator", that will later show
-\t\t\t\tup in the generator command as "autoconfigure nextgen A2LGenerator" (if "nextgen" is your
-\t\t\t\tproject name).
-
-\t\t\t\tNOTE: The content of this tag is ignored if generateDisabled = "true". -->
-\t\t\t\t<generatorTypes>
-\t\t\t\t\tgenerate_swcd "autoconfigure A2LGenerator" generate
-\t\t\t\t</generatorTypes>
+\t\t\t\tPath names must be relative to the $(PROJECT_ROOT) path. -->
+\t\t\t\t<mutableInputs>
+\t\t\t\t</mutableInputs>
+
+\t\t\t\t<!-- Defines the individual steps necessary to generate any required artifacts in
+\t\t\t\tthis project, in exactly the specified order.
+
+\t\t\t\tNOTE: If the buildSteps element is missing, or if it doesn\'t contain any buildStep
+\t\t\t\tchild element, it is understood that this project was checked-in along with all
+\t\t\t\tits resulting artifacts, and no attempt should be made at rebuilding it. -->
+
+\t\t\t\t<buildSteps>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<!-- Import tresos project into the parent workspace. -->
+\t\t\t\t\t<buildStep>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<executor>$(TRESOS_CMD_BATCH_FILE)</executor>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<args>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="string">-data</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(WORKSPACE_DIR)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="string">importProject</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(PROJECT_ROOT)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t</args>
+\t\t\t\t\t</buildStep>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<!-- Transfer / preprocess *.arxml files from BSW DaVinci project to this
+\t\t\t\t\tproject and then run tresos. Very ugly hack ... AUTOSAR projects should not have
+\t\t\t\t\tdependencies on other AUTOSAR projects. Sadly necessary because the P2 100 kW
+\t\t\t\t\tproject currently uses a mix of Elektrobit and Vector modules (MCAL from
+\t\t\t\t\tElektrobit, most of the rest from Vector). -->
+\t\t\t\t\t<buildStep>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<executor>$(PYTHON_EXE)</executor>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<args>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(RUN_TRESOS_GENERATION_SCRIPT)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(TRESOS_CMD_BATCH_FILE)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(PROJECT_ROOT)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(ARTIFACTS_ROOT)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(DEFAULT_BUILD_ROOT)/BSW_utils/BSW_Config.json</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(project::BSW::PROJECT_ROOT)/Config/ECUC</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(PROJECT_ROOT)/config_arxml</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(COMPONENT_ROOT)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t</args>
+\t\t\t\t\t</buildStep>
+
+\t\t\t\t</buildSteps>
+
+\t\t\t</project>
+
+\t\t\t<project name="BSW" toolChainInstance="Vector_DaVinciConfigurator_R25">
+
+\t\t\t\t<artifactRootDir>Appl/GenData</artifactRootDir>
+
+\t\t\t\t<userDefinedSymbols>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>PYTHON_EXE</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>$(TOOLS_OTS)/python/64bit/python-3.4.3.amd64/python.exe</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>CREATE_MAKEFILE_FOR_VECTOR_GENERATED_FILES_SCRIPT</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>$(DEFAULT_BUILD_ROOT)/BSW_utils/createMakefileForVectorGeneratedFiles.py</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>DELETE_MEM_MAP_HEADERS_SCRIPT</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>$(DEFAULT_BUILD_ROOT)/BSW_utils/deleteMemMapHeaders.pl</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>BSW_CONFIG_FILE</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>$(DEFAULT_BUILD_ROOT)/BSW_utils/BSW_Config.json</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t</userDefinedSymbols>
+
+\t\t\t\t<mutableInputs>
+\t\t\t\t</mutableInputs>
+
+\t\t\t\t<!-- When checking whether an AUTOSAR archive is up-to-date, normally only the config
+\t\t\t\tfiles in the AUTOSAR project as well as the plugins and the tool installation folder
+\t\t\t\tare taken into consideration. However, since generating the artifacts for this
+\t\t\t\tparticular AUTOSAR project also involves some hand-rolled tool scripts, it is
+\t\t\t\tnecessary to include these in the check. -->
+\t\t\t\t<additionalInputs>
+\t\t\t\t\t<additionalInput>$(CREATE_MAKEFILE_FOR_VECTOR_GENERATED_FILES_SCRIPT)</additionalInput>
+\t\t\t\t\t<additionalInput>$(DELETE_MEM_MAP_HEADERS_SCRIPT)</additionalInput>
+\t\t\t\t\t<additionalInput>$(BSW_CONFIG_FILE)</additionalInput>
+\t\t\t\t</additionalInputs>
+
+\t\t\t\t<buildSteps>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<!-- Creates C files. -->
+\t\t\t\t\t<buildStep>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<executor>$(VECTOR_GENERATOR_TOOL)</executor>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<args>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="string">--project</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(PROJECT_ROOT)/Proj_100KW.dpa</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="string">--generate</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="string">-modulesToExclude</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="string">"/MICROSAR/Os"</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="string">--extGenStepsToGenerate</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="string">""</arg>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t\t</args>
+\t\t\t\t\t</buildStep>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<!-- Creates DEM slave A2L file. -->
+\t\t\t\t\t<buildStep>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<executor>$(DEM_A2L_GENERATOR)</executor>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<args>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(PROJECT_ROOT)/Appl/GenData</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(COMPONENTS_FOLDER)/Dem/Implementation</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(COMPONENTS_FOLDER)/Dcm/Implementation</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="string">-f</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="string">-o</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(PROJECT_ROOT)/Appl/GenData</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t</args>
+\t\t\t\t\t</buildStep>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<!-- Sanitize the output generated by DaVinci. We will have to delete some stuff
+\t\t\t\t\twe don\'t want to interfere with our build, such as the *_MemMap.h and *_vMemMap.h
+\t\t\t\t\tfiles generated here. -->
+\t\t\t\t\t<buildStep>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<executor>$(PERL)</executor>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<args>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(DELETE_MEM_MAP_HEADERS_SCRIPT)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(ARTIFACTS_ROOT)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="string">^.+_MemMap.h$</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="string">^.+_vMemMap.h$</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t</args>
+\t\t\t\t\t</buildStep>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<!-- Create Vector Make_cfg.mak file (not generated by Vector for this project).
+
+\t\t\t\t\tATTENTION: In the prototype solution, there was only __1__ call for
+\t\t\t\t\t-vectorMake, because instead of 2 individual Vector projects there was 1
+\t\t\t\t\tcombined Vector project. We now create this makefile once for each Vector project,
+\t\t\t\t\twhich is kind of a hack but works because the duplicate paths added by this
+\t\t\t\t\tmakefile being read twice are filtered out by the build system. -->
+\t\t\t\t\t<buildStep>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<executor>$(PYTHON_EXE)</executor>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<args>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(CREATE_MAKEFILE_FOR_VECTOR_GENERATED_FILES_SCRIPT)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(BSW_CONFIG_FILE)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(ARTIFACTS_ROOT)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t</args>
+\t\t\t\t\t</buildStep>
+
+\t\t\t\t</buildSteps>
+
+\t\t\t</project>
+
+\t\t\t<project name="OS" toolChainInstance="Vector_DaVinciConfigurator_Os">
+
+\t\t\t\t<artifactRootDir>Appl/GenData</artifactRootDir>
+
+\t\t\t\t<userDefinedSymbols>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>OS_OS_ECUC_ARXML_REL_PATH</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>Config/ECUC/Proj_100KW_Os_Os_ecuc.arxml</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>PYTHON_EXE</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>$(TOOLS_OTS)/python/64bit/python-3.4.3.amd64/python.exe</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<symbol>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<name>CREATE_MAKEFILE_FOR_VECTOR_GENERATED_FILES_SCRIPT</name>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<value>$(DEFAULT_BUILD_ROOT)/BSW_utils/createMakefileForVectorGeneratedFiles.py</value>
+\t\t\t\t\t</symbol>
+
+\t\t\t\t</userDefinedSymbols>
+
 \t\t\t\t<mutableInputs>
-\t\t\t\t\t<mutableInput>
-\t\t\t\t\t\tconfig/SystemModel2.tdb
-\t\t\t\t\t</mutableInput>
 \t\t\t\t</mutableInputs>
+
+\t\t\t\t<!-- The additionalInputs section is relevant only for archive re-use
+\t\t\t\tpurposes. When checking whether an existing archive is up-to-date, normally only
+\t\t\t\ta well-defined set of file is includes in the check (namely, any config files in
+\t\t\t\tthe AUTOSAR project directory tree, the plugins, and the contents of the tool
+\t\t\t\tchain installation directory. However, if the AUTOSAR project relies on inputs
+\t\t\t\tfrom outside the aforementioned sources, e.g. a user-provided python script,
+\t\t\t\tthese have to be specified here. -->
+\t\t\t\t<additionalInputs>
+\t\t\t\t\t<additionalInput>$(CREATE_MAKEFILE_FOR_VECTOR_GENERATED_FILES_SCRIPT)</additionalInput>
+\t\t\t\t</additionalInputs>
+
+\t\t\t\t<buildSteps>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<!-- Copies the OS ECU ARXML file from the BSW project to this project. Not pretty,
+\t\t\t\t\tbut sadly unavoidable. The explanation given by Vinu-Avinash GOPAKUMAR is that
+\t\t\t\t\tdevelopers will only actively maintain the configuration for the BSW project,
+\t\t\t\t\tand the OS project has to use the same configuration. -->
+\t\t\t\t\t<buildStep>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<executor>$(CP)</executor>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<args>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(project::BSW::PROJECT_ROOT)/$(OS_OS_ECUC_ARXML_REL_PATH)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(PROJECT_ROOT)/$(OS_OS_ECUC_ARXML_REL_PATH)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t</args>
+\t\t\t\t\t</buildStep>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<!-- Creates C files. -->
+\t\t\t\t\t<buildStep>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<executor>$(VECTOR_GENERATOR_TOOL)</executor>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<args>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="string">--project</arg>

+\t\t\t\t\t\t</args>
+\t\t\t\t\t</buildStep>
+
+\t\t\t\t\t<!-- Create Vector Make_cfg.mak file (not generated by Vector for this project).
+
+\t\t\t\t\tATTENTION: In the prototype solution, there was only __1__ call for
+\t\t\t\t\t-vectorMake, because instead of 2 individual Vector projects there was 1
+\t\t\t\t\tcombined Vector project. We now create this makefile once for each Vector project,
+\t\t\t\t\twhich is kind of a hack but works because the duplicate paths added by this
+\t\t\t\t\tmakefile being read twice are filtered out by the build system. -->
+\t\t\t\t\t<buildStep>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<executor>$(PYTHON_EXE)</executor>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t<args>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(CREATE_MAKEFILE_FOR_VECTOR_GENERATED_FILES_SCRIPT)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(DEFAULT_BUILD_ROOT)/BSW_utils/BSW_Config.json</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<arg type="path">$(ARTIFACTS_ROOT)</arg>
+\t\t\t\t\t\t</args>
+\t\t\t\t\t</buildStep>
+
+\t\t\t\t</buildSteps>
+

-\t\t\t\t</path>
 \t\t\t</component>
+
 \t\t\t<component name="SECU_VERSION_INFO_FILE">
+\t\t\t\t<path>$(REPO_ROOT)/src/fw_cu/Components/Cmn/Secu/SecuSrv/doc/VersInfo.txt</path>
 \t\t\t\t<includeIn>
-\t\t\t\t\t<additionalTargetPath>
-\t\t\t\t\t\tbin/SecuSrv_Version.txt
-\t\t\t\t\t</additionalTargetPath>
+\t\t\t\t\t<additionalTargetPath>bin/SecuSrv_Version.txt</additionalTargetPath>
 \t\t\t\t</includeIn>
-\t\t\t\t<path>
-\t\t\t\t\t$(REPO_ROOT)/src/fw_cu/Components/Cmn/Secu/SecuSrv/doc/VersInfo.txt
-\t\t\t\t</path>
 \t\t\t</component>
+
 \t\t</externalComponents>
-\t\t<outputFileFormat>
-\t\t\t.hex
-\t\t</outputFileFormat>
-\t\t<sourceCodeRootDir>
-\t\t\t$(COMPONENT_ROOT)/Components
-\t\t</sourceCodeRootDir>
+
+\t\t<!-- Format of output files. Supported formats are hex and mot. -->
+\t\t<outputFileFormat>.hex</outputFileFormat>
+
+\t\t<!-- The root directory of any source code modules. -->
+\t\t<sourceCodeRootDir>$(COMPONENT_ROOT)/Components</sourceCodeRootDir>
+
 \t</buildProcessSpecifics>
-</project>
+
+</component>
diff --git a/src/fw_cu/build/VectorGeneration.bat b/src/fw_cu/build/VectorGeneration.bat
deleted file mode 100644
index 0f548bc73..000000000
--- a/src/fw_cu/build/VectorGeneration.bat
+++ /dev/null
@@ -1,167 +0,0 @@
-ECHO OFF
-SetLocal EnableDelayedExpansion
-CLS
-
-SET M=%1
-SET SETFROMOUTSIDE=0
-IF NOT [%M%]==[] SET SETFROMOUTSIDE=1
-
-:MENU
-ECHO.
-ECHO ...............................................
-ECHO Vector Code Generation
-ECHO ...............................................
-ECHO.
-ECHO 1 - Patch CM for VDC
-ECHO 2 - Generate BSW modules in Vector DC
-ECHO 3 - Generate Os in Vector DC
-ECHO 4 - Generate MCAL Modules in Tresos
-ECHO 5 - Generate Make file for Vector and Tresos
-ECHO 6 - Generate BSW A2L
-ECHO 7 - Execute combined options from 1 till 6 in sequence
-ECHO 8 - Clean Output folder and build
-ECHO 9 - Incremental build
-ECHO 10 - Complete Rebuild (Options 7 + 8)
-ECHO 11 - Exit
-ECHO.
-SET Chain=0
-SET REBUILD=0
-SET ToolsFolder=..\\..\\..\\tools
-SET WorkSpaceFolder=..\\..\\..\\src\\fw_cu\\workspace
-SET VectorGenTool=%ToolsFolder%\\ots\\Vector_DaVinciConfigurator_R25\\DaVinciConfigurator\\Core\\DVCfgCmd
-SET VectorOsGenTool=%ToolsFolder%\\ots\\Vector_DaVinciConfigurator_Os\\DaVinciConfigurator\\Core\\DVCfgCmd
-SET VectorWorkspace=%WorkSpaceFolder%\\Vector_Workspace
-SET VectorOsWorkspace=%WorkSpaceFolder%\\Vector_WorkspaceOs
-SET VectorSubmodule=%ToolsFolder%\\ots\\Vector_DaVinciConfigurator_R25
-SET DemA2LGen=%VectorSubmodule%\\Misc\\Diag_A2lGen\\Application\\Diag_A2lGen.exe
-SET TresosWorkSpace=%WorkSpaceFolder%\\Tresos\
extgen
-SET TresosGenTool=%ToolsFolder%\\ots\\tresos\\bin\\tresos_cmd
-SET PythonPath=%ToolsFolder%\\ots\\python\\64bit\\python-3.4.3.amd64\\python.exe
-IF [%M%]==[] SET /P M=Select an option:
-IF %M%==1 GOTO OP1
-IF %M%==2 GOTO OP2
-IF %M%==3 GOTO OP3
-IF %M%==4 GOTO OP4
-IF %M%==5 GOTO OP5
-IF %M%==6 GOTO OP6
-IF %M%==7 GOTO OP7
-IF %M%==8 GOTO OP8
-IF %M%==9 GOTO OP9
-IF %M%==10 GOTO OP10
-IF %M%==11 GOTO OP11
-
-REM Goto Menu if none of the predefined options are selected.
-GOTO MENU
-
-:OP1
-IF [%SETFROMOUTSIDE%]==[1] ECHO Registering required external DLLs
-IF [%SETFROMOUTSIDE%]==[1] powershell -file RegisterAndCheckDll.ps1 %ToolsFolder%\\ots\\Vector_DaVinciConfigurator_Os\\DaVinciConfigurator\\Core\\ExternalComponents\\MultiOSMgr.dll
-IF [%SETFROMOUTSIDE%]==[1] powershell -file RegisterAndCheckDll.ps1 %ToolsFolder%\\ots\\Vector_DaVinciConfigurator_Os\\DaVinciConfigurator\\Core\\ExternalComponents\\DVSharedComponentProxy.dll
-IF [%SETFROMOUTSIDE%]==[1] powershell -file RegisterAndCheckDll.ps1 %ToolsFolder%\\ots\\Vector_DaVinciConfigurator_Os\\DaVinciConfigurator\\Core\\ExternalComponents\\DVSharedComponentProxy64.dll
-ECHO Patching the CM files to accommodate Vector generated files.
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\AutosarLib.pm %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\lib\\ComponentBuildModules\\AutosarLib.pm /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\integrate_generated_AUTOSAR_modules.mak %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\commonMakeFiles\\AUTOSAR\\integrate_generated_AUTOSAR_modules.mak /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\integrateAutoCorePlugins.mak %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\commonMakeFiles\\AUTOSAR\\integrateAutoCorePlugins.mak /y
-REM xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\integrate_sub_module_makefiles.mak %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\commonMakeFiles\\integrate_sub_module_makefiles.mak /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\A2L.mak %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\commonMakeFiles\\A2L.mak /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\Document.pm %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\lib\\A2L_Lib2\\Document.pm /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\Parse_DEM_header.pm %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\lib\\Parse_DEM_header.pm /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\adapt_dem_a2l.pl %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\bin\\build_tools\\a2l\\adapt_dem_a2l.pl /y  
-IF %Chain%==1 GOTO OP2
-SET M=
-GOTO MENU
-:OP2
-ECHO Invoking VDC to generate BSW modules.
-rmdir %VectorWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData /s /q
-CALL %VectorGenTool% --project %VectorWorkspace%\\Proj_100KW.dpa --generate -modulesToExclude "/MICROSAR/Os" --extGenStepsToGenerate ""
-ECHO Copying generated file to Vector_Generated and sanitizing them.
-IF exist %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated (
-ECHO Old files in %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated will be deleted
-rmdir %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated /s /q)
-REM creating new folder structure
-mkdir %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\src
-mkdir %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include
-mkdir %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\make
-REM copying files from Vector BSW Generation.
-XCOPY %VectorWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData\\*.h %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include
-XCOPY %VectorWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData\\Components\\*.h %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include
-XCOPY %VectorWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData\\*.c %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\src
-REM deleting unneeded memmap files which do not confirm to VSeA software structure
-DEL %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include\\*_MemMap.h
-DEL %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include\\*_vMemMap.h
-IF %Chain%==1 GOTO OP3
-SET M=
-GOTO MENU
-:OP3
-ECHO Invoking VDC to generate Os module.
-rmdir %VectorOsWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData /s /q
-XCOPY %VectorWorkspace%\\Config\\ECUC\\Proj_100KW_Os_Os_ecuc.arxml %VectorOsWorkspace%\\Config\\ECUC\\Proj_100KW_Os_Os_ecuc.arxml /y
-CALL %VectorOsGenTool% --project %VectorOsWorkspace%\\Proj_100KW.dpa --generate
-ECHO Copying generated file to Vector_Generated.
-REM copying Os files from Vector Generated folder to "Vector_Generated" folder.
-XCOPY %VectorOsWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData\\*.h %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include /y
-XCOPY %VectorOsWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData\\*.c %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\src /y
-IF %Chain%==1 GOTO OP4
-SET M=
-GOTO MENU
-:OP4
-ECHO Calling make_fw_cu with --exportAutosar to setup the tresos submodule
-CALL make_fw_cu.cmd --exportAutosar
-ECHO Processing MCAL ARXML files for Tresos
-%PythonPath% BSWUtil.py BSW_Config.json -p %VectorWorkspace%\\Config\\ECUC %TresosWorkSpace%\\config_arxml
-ECHO Invoking Tresos for generating MCAL modules.
-SET TRESOSARG=
-for /F "delims=" %%i in (.\\output\\misc\\tresosargument.txt) do set TRESOSARG=%%i
-SET TEMPTRESOSARG=-n Base -n Compiler -g Base_TS_TxDxM5I0R0 -g Compiler_TS_TxDxM1I0R0  %TresosWorkSpace%\\config\\OutputArxml\\Base.arxml@asc:4.2.2 %TresosWorkSpace%\\config\\OutputArxml\\Compiler.arxml@asc:4.2.2
-
-IF exist %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated (
-ECHO Old files in %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated will be deleted
-rmdir %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated /s /q)
-REM creating new folder
-mkdir %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated
-CALL %TresosGenTool% -DValidate=true -Dtarget=TRICORE -Dderivate=TC37XT legacy generate %TRESOSARG% %TEMPTRESOSARG% -o %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated
-IF %Chain%==1 GOTO OP5
-SET M=
-GOTO MENU
-:OP5
-%PythonPath% BSWUtil.py BSW_Config.json -tm %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated\\make
-%PythonPath% BSWUtil.py BSW_Config.json -vm %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\make
-IF %Chain%==1 GOTO OP6
-SET M=
-GOTO MENU
-:OP6
-REM Generate A2l for DEM FIM and DCM
-CALL %DemA2LGen% %VectorWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData %VectorSubmodule%\\Components\\Dem\\Implementation %VectorSubmodule%\\Components\\Dcm\\Implementation -f -o %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated
-IF exist %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\Dem.a2l (
-REM ECHO f | xcopy /f /y  %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\Dem.a2l %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated\\bsw.a2l)
-copy /b/y %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\Dem.a2l %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated\\bsw.a2l)
-IF %Chain%==1 SET Chain=0
-IF %REBUILD%==1 (
-SET REBUILD=0
-GOTO OP8 )
-SET M=
-GOTO MENU
-:OP7
-SET Chain=1
-GOTO OP1
-:OP8
-IF exist .\\output (
-rmdir .\\output /s /q )
-CALL make_fw_cu.cmd --all --noAutosarArchive
-IF [%SETFROMOUTSIDE%]==[1] GOTO OP11
-SET M=
-GOTO MENU
-:OP9
-CALL make_fw_cu.cmd --all --noAutosarArchive
-SET M=
-GOTO MENU
-:OP10
-SET REBUILD=1
-SET CHAIN=1
-GOTO OP1
-:OP11
-GOTO EOF
-EXIT
-
-
-:EOF
\\ No newline at end of file

-ECHO OFF
-SetLocal EnableDelayedExpansion
-CLS
-:MENU
-ECHO.
-ECHO ...............................................
-ECHO Vector Code Generation
-ECHO ...............................................
-ECHO.
-ECHO 1 - Patch CM for VDC
-ECHO 2 - Generate BSW modules in Vector DC
-ECHO 3 - Generate Os in Vector DC
-ECHO 4 - Generate MCAL Modules in Tresos
-ECHO 5 - Generate Make file for Vector and Tresos
-ECHO 6 - Generate BSW A2L
-ECHO 7 - Execute combined options from 1 till 6 in sequence
-ECHO 8 - Clean Output folder and build
-ECHO 9 - Incremental build
-ECHO 10 - Complete Rebuild (Options 7 + 8)
-ECHO 11 - Exit
-ECHO.
-SET Chain=0
-SET REBUILD=0
-SET ToolsFolder=..\\..\\..\\tools
-SET WorkSpaceFolder=..\\..\\..\\src\\fw_cu\\workspace
-SET VectorGenTool=%ToolsFolder%\\ots\\Vector_DaVinciConfigurator_R25\\DaVinciConfigurator\\Core\\DVCfgCmd
-SET VectorOsGenTool=%ToolsFolder%\\ots\\Vector_DaVinciConfigurator_Os\\DaVinciConfigurator\\Core\\DVCfgCmd

-SET VectorOsWorkspace=%WorkSpaceFolder%\\Vector_WorkspaceOs
-SET VectorSubmodule=%ToolsFolder%\\ots\\Vector_DaVinciConfigurator_R25
-SET DemA2LGen=%VectorSubmodule%\\Misc\\Diag_A2lGen\\Application\\Diag_A2lGen.exe
-SET TresosWorkSpace=%WorkSpaceFolder%\\Tresos\
extgen
-SET TresosGenTool=%ToolsFolder%\\ots\\tresos\\bin\\tresos_cmd
-SET PythonPath=%ToolsFolder%\\ots\\python\\64bit\\python-3.4.3.amd64\\python.exe
-SET /P M=Select an option:
-IF %M%==1 GOTO OP1
-IF %M%==2 GOTO OP2
-IF %M%==3 GOTO OP3
-IF %M%==4 GOTO OP4
-IF %M%==5 GOTO OP5
-IF %M%==6 GOTO OP6
-IF %M%==7 GOTO OP7
-IF %M%==8 GOTO OP8
-IF %M%==9 GOTO OP9
-IF %M%==10 GOTO OP10
-IF %M%==11 GOTO OP11
-
-REM Goto Menu if none of the predefined options are selected.
-GOTO MENU
-
-:OP1
-ECHO Patching the CM files to accommodate Vector generated files.
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\AutosarLib.pm %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\lib\\ComponentBuildModules\\AutosarLib.pm /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\integrate_generated_AUTOSAR_modules.mak %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\commonMakeFiles\\AUTOSAR\\integrate_generated_AUTOSAR_modules.mak /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\integrateAutoCorePlugins.mak %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\commonMakeFiles\\AUTOSAR\\integrateAutoCorePlugins.mak /y
-REM xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\integrate_sub_module_makefiles.mak %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\commonMakeFiles\\integrate_sub_module_makefiles.mak /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\A2L.mak %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\commonMakeFiles\\A2L.mak /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\Document.pm %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\lib\\A2L_Lib2\\Document.pm /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\Parse_DEM_header.pm %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\lib\\Parse_DEM_header.pm /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\adapt_dem_a2l.pl %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\bin\\build_tools\\a2l\\adapt_dem_a2l.pl /y  
-IF %Chain%==1 GOTO OP2
-GOTO MENU
-:OP2
-ECHO Invoking VDC to generate BSW modules.
-rmdir %VectorWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData /s /q
-CALL %VectorGenTool% --project %VectorWorkspace%\\Proj_100KW.dpa --generate -modulesToExclude "/MICROSAR/Os" --extGenStepsToGenerate ""
-ECHO Copying generated file to Vector_Generated and sanitizing them.
-IF exist %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated (
-ECHO Old files in %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated will be deleted
-rmdir %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated /s /q)
-REM creating new folder structure
-mkdir %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\src
-mkdir %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include
-mkdir %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\make
-REM copying files from Vector BSW Generation.
-XCOPY %VectorWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData\\*.h %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include
-XCOPY %VectorWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData\\Components\\*.h %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include
-XCOPY %VectorWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData\\*.c %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\src
-REM deleting unneeded memmap files which do not confirm to VSeA software structure
-DEL %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include\\*_MemMap.h
-DEL %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include\\*_vMemMap.h
-IF %Chain%==1 GOTO OP3
-GOTO MENU
-:OP3
-ECHO Invoking VDC to generate Os module.
-rmdir %VectorOsWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData /s /q
-XCOPY %VectorWorkspace%\\Config\\ECUC\\Proj_100KW_Os_Os_ecuc.arxml %VectorOsWorkspace%\\Config\\ECUC\\Proj_100KW_Os_Os_ecuc.arxml /y
-CALL %VectorOsGenTool% --project %VectorOsWorkspace%\\Proj_100KW.dpa --generate
-ECHO Copying generated file to Vector_Generated.
-REM copying Os files from Vector Generated folder to "Vector_Generated" folder.
-XCOPY %VectorOsWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData\\*.h %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include /y
-XCOPY %VectorOsWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData\\*.c %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\src /y
-IF %Chain%==1 GOTO OP4
-GOTO MENU
-:OP4
-ECHO Calling make_fw_cu with --exportAutosar to setup the tresos submodule
-REM CALL make_fw_cu.cmd --exportAutosar
-ECHO Processing MCAL ARXML files for Tresos
-%PythonPath% BSWUtil.py BSW_Config.json -p %VectorWorkspace%\\Config\\ECUC %TresosWorkSpace%\\config_arxml
-ECHO Invoking Tresos for generating MCAL modules.
-SET TRESOSARG=
-for /F "delims=" %%i in (.\\output\\misc\\tresosargument.txt) do set TRESOSARG=%%i
-SET TEMPTRESOSARG=-n Base -n Compiler -g Base_TS_TxDxM5I0R0 -g Compiler_TS_TxDxM1I0R0  %TresosWorkSpace%\\config\\OutputArxml\\Base.arxml@asc:4.2.2 %TresosWorkSpace%\\config\\OutputArxml\\Compiler.arxml@asc:4.2.2
-
-IF exist %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated (
-ECHO Old files in %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated will be deleted
-rmdir %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated /s /q)
-REM creating new folder
-mkdir %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated
-CALL %TresosGenTool% -DValidate=true -Dtarget=TRICORE -Dderivate=TC37XT legacy generate %TRESOSARG% %TEMPTRESOSARG% -o %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated
-IF %Chain%==1 GOTO OP5
-GOTO MENU
-:OP5
-%PythonPath% BSWUtil.py BSW_Config.json -tm %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated\\make
-%PythonPath% BSWUtil.py BSW_Config.json -vm %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\make
-IF %Chain%==1 GOTO OP6
-GOTO MENU
-:OP6
-REM Generate A2l for DEM FIM and DCM
-CALL %DemA2LGen% %VectorWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData %VectorSubmodule%\\Components\\Dem\\Implementation %VectorSubmodule%\\Components\\Dcm\\Implementation -f -o %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated
-IF exist %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\Dem.a2l (
-ECHO f | xcopy /f /y  %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\Dem.a2l %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated\\bsw.a2l)
-IF %Chain%==1 SET Chain=0
-IF %REBUILD%==1 (
-SET REBUILD=0
-GOTO OP8 )
-GOTO MENU
-:OP7
-SET Chain=1
-GOTO OP1
-:OP8
-IF exist .\\output (
-rmdir .\\output /s /q )
-CALL make_fw_cu.cmd --all --noAutosarArchive --variant=SWIT
-GOTO MENU
-:OP9
-CALL make_fw_cu.cmd --all --noAutosarArchive --variant=SWIT
-GOTO MENU
-:OP10
-SET REBUILD=1
-SET CHAIN=1
-GOTO OP1
-:OP11
-GOTO EOF
-EXIT
-
-
-:EOF
\\ No newline at end of file

-SetLocal EnableDelayedExpansion
-CLS
-:MENU
-ECHO.
-ECHO ...............................................
-ECHO Vector Code Generation
-ECHO ...............................................
-ECHO.

-ECHO 2 - Generate BSW modules in Vector DC
-ECHO 3 - Generate Os in Vector DC
-ECHO 4 - Generate MCAL Modules in Tresos
-ECHO 5 - Generate Make file for Vector and Tresos
-ECHO 6 - Generate BSW A2L
-ECHO 7 - Execute combined options from 1 till 6 in sequence
-ECHO 8 - Clean Output folder and build
-ECHO 9 - Incremental build
-ECHO 10 - Complete Rebuild (Options 7 + 8)
-ECHO 11 - Exit
-ECHO.

-SET VectorOsGenTool=%ToolsFolder%\\ots\\Vector_DaVinciConfigurator_Os\\DaVinciConfigurator\\Core\\DVCfgCmd

-SET VectorOsWorkspace=%WorkSpaceFolder%\\Vector_WorkspaceOs

extgen
-SET TresosGenTool=%ToolsFolder%\\ots\\tresos\\bin\\tresos_cmd
-SET PythonPath=%ToolsFolder%\\ots\\python\\64bit\\python-3.4.3.amd64\\python.exe
-SET /P M=Select an option:
-IF %M%==1 GOTO OP1
-IF %M%==2 GOTO OP2
-IF %M%==3 GOTO OP3
-IF %M%==4 GOTO OP4
-IF %M%==5 GOTO OP5
-IF %M%==6 GOTO OP6
-IF %M%==7 GOTO OP7
-IF %M%==8 GOTO OP8
-IF %M%==9 GOTO OP9
-IF %M%==10 GOTO OP10
-IF %M%==11 GOTO OP11
-
-REM Goto Menu if none of the predefined options are selected.
-GOTO MENU
-
-:OP1
-ECHO Patching the CM files to accommodate Vector generated files.
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\AutosarLib.pm %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\lib\\ComponentBuildModules\\AutosarLib.pm /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\integrate_generated_AUTOSAR_modules.mak %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\commonMakeFiles\\AUTOSAR\\integrate_generated_AUTOSAR_modules.mak /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\integrateAutoCorePlugins.mak %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\commonMakeFiles\\AUTOSAR\\integrateAutoCorePlugins.mak /y
-REM xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\integrate_sub_module_makefiles.mak %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\commonMakeFiles\\integrate_sub_module_makefiles.mak /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\A2L.mak %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\commonMakeFiles\\A2L.mak /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\Document.pm %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\lib\\A2L_Lib2\\Document.pm /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\Parse_DEM_header.pm %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\lib\\Parse_DEM_header.pm /y
-xcopy .\\cmPatch4VectMigr\\adapt_dem_a2l.pl %ToolsFolder%\\cm\\bin\\build_tools\\a2l\\adapt_dem_a2l.pl /y  
-IF %Chain%==1 GOTO OP2
-GOTO MENU
-:OP2
-ECHO Invoking VDC to generate BSW modules.
-rmdir %VectorWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData /s /q
-CALL %VectorGenTool% --project %VectorWorkspace%\\Proj_100KW.dpa --generate -modulesToExclude "/MICROSAR/Os" --extGenStepsToGenerate ""
-ECHO Copying generated file to Vector_Generated and sanitizing them.
-IF exist %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated (
-ECHO Old files in %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated will be deleted
-rmdir %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated /s /q)
-REM creating new folder structure
-mkdir %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\src
-mkdir %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include
-mkdir %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\make
-REM copying files from Vector BSW Generation.
-XCOPY %VectorWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData\\*.h %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include
-XCOPY %VectorWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData\\Components\\*.h %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include
-XCOPY %VectorWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData\\*.c %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\src
-REM deleting unneeded memmap files which do not confirm to VSeA software structure
-DEL %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include\\*_MemMap.h
-DEL %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include\\*_vMemMap.h
-IF %Chain%==1 GOTO OP3
-GOTO MENU
-:OP3
-ECHO Invoking VDC to generate Os module.
-rmdir %VectorOsWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData /s /q
-XCOPY %VectorWorkspace%\\Config\\ECUC\\Proj_100KW_Os_Os_ecuc.arxml %VectorOsWorkspace%\\Config\\ECUC\\Proj_100KW_Os_Os_ecuc.arxml /y
-CALL %VectorOsGenTool% --project %VectorOsWorkspace%\\Proj_100KW.dpa --generate
-ECHO Copying generated file to Vector_Generated.
-REM copying Os files from Vector Generated folder to "Vector_Generated" folder.
-XCOPY %VectorOsWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData\\*.h %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\include /y
-XCOPY %VectorOsWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData\\*.c %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\src /y
-IF %Chain%==1 GOTO OP4
-GOTO MENU
-:OP4
-ECHO Calling make_fw_cu with --exportAutosar to setup the tresos submodule
-REM CALL make_fw_cu.cmd --exportAutosar
-ECHO Processing MCAL ARXML files for Tresos
-%PythonPath% BSWUtil.py BSW_Config.json -p %VectorWorkspace%\\Config\\ECUC %TresosWorkSpace%\\config_arxml
-ECHO Invoking Tresos for generating MCAL modules.
-SET TRESOSARG=
-for /F "delims=" %%i in (.\\output\\misc\\tresosargument.txt) do set TRESOSARG=%%i
-SET TEMPTRESOSARG=-n Base -n Compiler -g Base_TS_TxDxM5I0R0 -g Compiler_TS_TxDxM1I0R0  %TresosWorkSpace%\\config\\OutputArxml\\Base.arxml@asc:4.2.2 %TresosWorkSpace%\\config\\OutputArxml\\Compiler.arxml@asc:4.2.2
-
-IF exist %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated (
-ECHO Old files in %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated will be deleted
-rmdir %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated /s /q)
-REM creating new folder
-mkdir %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated
-CALL %TresosGenTool% -DValidate=true -Dtarget=TRICORE -Dderivate=TC37XT legacy generate %TRESOSARG% %TEMPTRESOSARG% -o %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated
-IF %Chain%==1 GOTO OP5
-GOTO MENU
-:OP5
-%PythonPath% BSWUtil.py BSW_Config.json -tm %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated\\make
-%PythonPath% BSWUtil.py BSW_Config.json -vm %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\make
-IF %Chain%==1 GOTO OP6
-GOTO MENU
-:OP6
-REM Generate A2l for DEM FIM and DCM
-CALL %DemA2LGen% %VectorWorkspace%\\Appl\\GenData %VectorSubmodule%\\Components\\Dem\\Implementation %VectorSubmodule%\\Components\\Dcm\\Implementation -f -o %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated
-IF exist %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\Dem.a2l (
-ECHO f | xcopy /f /y  %VectorWorkspace%\\Vector_Generated\\Dem.a2l %TresosWorkSpace%\\output\\generated\\bsw.a2l)
-IF %Chain%==1 SET Chain=0
-IF %REBUILD%==1 (
-SET REBUILD=0
-GOTO OP8 )
-GOTO MENU
-:OP7
-SET Chain=1
-GOTO OP1
-:OP8
-IF exist .\\output (
-rmdir .\\output /s /q )
-CALL make_fw_cu.cmd --all --noAutosarArchive --variant=SWIT_IT
-GOTO MENU
-:OP9
-CALL make_fw_cu.cmd --all --noAutosarArchive --variant=SWIT_IT
-GOTO MENU
-:OP10
-SET REBUILD=1
-SET CHAIN=1
-GOTO OP1
-:OP11
-GOTO EOF
-EXIT
-
-
-:EOF
\\ No newline at end of file
diff --git a/src/fw_cu/build/a2l/macros.tpl b/src/fw_cu/build/a2l/macros.tpl
