-sub new($$$$$$)
-{
-\tmy (
-\t\t$class,
-\t\t$importantPaths,
-\t\t$componentConfigReader,
-\t\t$dynamicVarsReader,
-\t\t$variantPath,
-\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t) = @_;
-
-\tmy $cleanedVariantPath = ComponentBuildModules::BuildVariantsHandler::cleanVariantPath(
-\t\t$variantPath,
-\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t);
-
-\tmy %members = (
-\t\t\'componentConfigReader\' => $componentConfigReader,
-\t\t\'dynamicVarsReader\'     => $dynamicVarsReader,
-\t\t\'finalConfig\'           => undef,
-\t\t\'importantPaths\'        => $importantPaths,
-\t\t\'parsedConfig\'          => undef,
-\t\t\'selectedVariantPath\'   => undef,
-\t\t\'variantPath\'           => $cleanedVariantPath
-\t);
-
-\treturn bless \\%members, ref $class || $class;
-}
-
-sub setUp_AUTOSAR_optionsAndTargets($$$$)
-{
-\tmy ( $self, $optionsHandler, $onlyWantHelp, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tif ( ! __componentUses_AUTOSAR_toolchain( $self, $onlyWantHelp, $dbgLogger ) )
-\t{
-\t\t# Since the component does not use AUTOSAR it would be silly to pollute the environment
-\t\t# with useless options / targets. :)
-\t\treturn;
-\t}
-
-\t$optionsHandler->addOption(
-\t\tComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::Base::OPT_NAME_IGNORE_ARCHIVE,
-\t\t\'Special option for BSW developers. With this option, the build will never try to use an \' .
-\t\t\t\'existing AUTOSAR archive.\'
-\t);
-
-\t$optionsHandler->addTarget(
-\t\t\'rebuildAutosar\',
-\t\t\'Enforces a complete rebuild of any AUTOSAR-generated files, even if the system \' .
-\t\t\t\'determines the workspace files to already be up-to-date.\'
-\t);
-
-\t$optionsHandler->addTarget(
-\t\t\'setUpAutosar\',
-\t\t\'Convenience target that ensures AUTOSAR files are up-to-date and then immediately exits.\'
-\t);
-
-\t$optionsHandler->addExample(
-\t\t\'--all --\' . ComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::Base::OPT_NAME_IGNORE_ARCHIVE,
-\t\t\'Updates all targets. Completely ignores the AUTOSAR archive and, if not already done, \' .
-\t\t\t\'rebuilds the AUTOSAR workspace based on the current *.xdm, *.arxml, etc. \' .
-\t\t\t\'configuration files.\'
-\t);
-
-\t$optionsHandler->addExample(
-\t\t\'--rebuildAutosar\',
-\t\t\'Only rebuilds the AUTOSAR-generated files (including the AUTOSAR archive).\'
-\t);
-
-\t$optionsHandler->addTarget(
-\t\t\'exportAutosar\',
-\t\t\'Exports AUTOSAR workspace to the Eclipse IDE (which is also one of the side effects of \' .
-\t\t\t\'--rebuildAutosar).\'
-\t);
-}
-
-sub force_AUTOSAR_rebuild($$$)
-{
-\tmy ( $self, $optionsDictionary, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tmy %finalAutosarConfig = __getFinal_AUTOSAR_config( $self, $dbgLogger );
-
-\tmy ( $useOfArchiveFeatureDisabled ) = __useOfArchiveFeatureDisabled(
-\t\t$optionsDictionary,
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t%finalAutosarConfig
-\t);
-
-\tif ( $useOfArchiveFeatureDisabled )
-\t{
-\t\t# Use of archive feature is not allowed -> just rebuild workspace, but do not archive it.
-\t\tComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::RebuildWorkspace::rebuild_AUTOSAR(
-\t\t\t__getImportantPathsDict( $self ),
-\t\t\tundef,
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t\t%finalAutosarConfig
-\t\t);
-\t}
-\telse
-\t{
-\t\t# Use of archive feature is allowed -> also archive freshly built workspace.
-\t\t__updateAutosarArchiveAndWorkspace(
-\t\t\t$optionsDictionary,
-\t\t\t__getImportantPathsDict( $self ),
-\t\t\t__getDynamicVarsReader( $self ),
-\t\t\tTRUE,
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t\t%finalAutosarConfig
-\t\t);
-\t}
-}
-
-sub __export_AUTOSAR_env($$%)
-{
-\tmy ( $dynamicVarsWriter, $dbgLogger, %autosarConfigDictionary ) = @_;
-
-\tmy $mainProjectName = $autosarConfigDictionary{ \'MAIN_PROJECT_NAME\' };
-
-\tif ( StringFuncs::null( $mainProjectName ) )
-\t{
-\t\t$dbgLogger->print(
-\t\t\t\'MAIN_PROJECT_NAME attribute not found in AUTOSAR config. Assuming AUTOSAR not needed.\'
-\t\t);
-
-\t\treturn;
-\t}
-
-\t$dynamicVarsWriter->addVariable(
-\t\t\'AUTOCORE_PLUGINS_PATH\',
-\t\t$autosarConfigDictionary{ \'AUTOCORE_PLUGINS_ROOT\' }
-\t);
-
-\tmy $tresosWorkspaceRootDir = $autosarConfigDictionary{ \'TRESOS_WORKSPACE_ROOT\' };
-\t$dynamicVarsWriter->addVariable( \'WORKSPACE_ROOT\', $tresosWorkspaceRootDir );
-
-\tmy $projectsList = $autosarConfigDictionary{ \'projects\' };
-\tassert( defined( $projectsList ) );
-
-\tmy $mainProjectData = ComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::Base::findProjectByName(
-\t\t$projectsList,
-\t\t$mainProjectName,
-\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t);
-
-\tassert( defined( $mainProjectData ) );
-
-\tmy $mainProjectDirectoryPath = $$mainProjectData{ \'projectDirectoryPath\' };
-\tassert( ! StringFuncs::null( $mainProjectDirectoryPath ) );
-
-\t# This variable is referenced in many Tresos plugin makefiles.
-\t$dynamicVarsWriter->addVariable( \'PROJECT_ROOT\', $mainProjectDirectoryPath );
-
-\tmy $autosarGeneratedDir = FileUtil::join(
-\t\t$mainProjectDirectoryPath,
-\t\tComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::Base::REL_OUTPUT_GENERATED_PATH_LIST
-\t);
-\t
-\tmy $vectorGeneratedDir = FileUtil::join(
-\t\t$tresosWorkspaceRootDir,
-\t\t\'..\', \'Vector_Workspace\',\'Vector_Generated\'
-\t);
-
-\t# GENERATED_DIR is the root of the directory tree into which the Tresos AUTOSAR thingy dumps
-\t# the output files of the main project. The variable is referenced in various AUTOSAR makefiles.
-\t# AUTOSAR_GENERATED_DIR is an alias that our build tooling applies because \'GENERATED_DIR\' in
-\t# itself isn\'t really a very expressive name.
-\t$dynamicVarsWriter->addVariable( \'GENERATED_DIR\', $autosarGeneratedDir );
-\t$dynamicVarsWriter->addVariable( \'AUTOSAR_GENERATED_DIR\', $autosarGeneratedDir );
-\t$dynamicVarsWriter->addVariable( \'VECTOR_GENERATED_DIR\', $vectorGeneratedDir );
-\t$dynamicVarsWriter->addVariable(
-\t\t\'GENERATED_STAT\',
-\t\tFileUtil::join( $mainProjectDirectoryPath, \'output_static\', \'generated\' )
-\t);
-}
-
-# Returns a list containing the path names of any files that must never be blacklisted during the
-# cross-check between the local config and the config used to build an AUTOSAR archive.
-sub __getCrossCheckWhitelist($%)
-{
-\tmy ( $dbgLogger, %autosarConfigDictionary ) = @_;
-
-\tmy $projects = $autosarConfigDictionary{ \'projects\' };
-
-\tmy @alwaysWhitelistThese = ();
-
-\tforeach my $thisProject ( @$projects )
-\t{
-\t\t# Regardless of what directories have been blacklisted ... these guys must always be exempt
-\t\t# from blacklisting (because they are modified by us).
-\t\tmy $preferencesTemplate = $$thisProject{ \'preferencesFile\' };
-
-\t\tif ( ! StringFuncs::null( $preferencesTemplate ) )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tpush( @alwaysWhitelistThese, $preferencesTemplate );
-\t\t}
-\t}
-
-\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t"Got %u files in cross-check whitelist:\
\
\\t%s\
",
-\t\tscalar( @alwaysWhitelistThese ),
-\t\tjoin( "\
\\t", sort( @alwaysWhitelistThese ) )
-\t);
-
-\treturn @alwaysWhitelistThese;
-}
-
-sub __combineListEntries($$$)
-{
-\tmy ( $first, $second, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tmy @result = ();
-
-\tforeach my $entryFromFirstList ( @$first )
-\t{
-\t\tforeach my $entryFromSecondList ( @$second )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tpush( @result, $entryFromFirstList . $entryFromSecondList );
-\t\t}
-\t}
-
-\treturn @result;
-}
-
-sub __getConfigFileCombinations($%)
-{
-\tmy ( $dbgLogger, %autosarConfigDictionary ) = @_;
-
-\tmy @dirsToSearch = (
-\t\t$autosarConfigDictionary{ \'TRESOS_ROOT_FOLDER\' },
-\t\t$autosarConfigDictionary{ \'DAVINCI_ROOT_FOLDER\' },
-\t\t$autosarConfigDictionary{ \'TRESOS_WORKSPACE_ROOT\' },
-\t\t@{ $autosarConfigDictionary{ \'ARCHIVE_WATCH_ADDITIONAL_INCLUDES\' } }
-\t);
-
-\t# Since we have at least one optional directory that may not be configured in every project,
-\t# lose all empty entries.
-\t@dirsToSearch = grep { ! StringFuncs::nullOrWhitespace( $_ ) } @dirsToSearch;
-
-\tmy $searchRegEx = \'(?xi).+\\.(?:\' . join( \'|\', AUTOSAR_CONFIG_FILE_TYPES ) . \')$\';
-
-\treturn ( \\@dirsToSearch, qr/$searchRegEx/ );
-}
-
-# Returns a list containing the absolute paths of all AutoCore plugin directories.
-sub __getAutoCorePluginDirs($$)
-{
-\tmy ( $autoCorePluginsRootDir, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tif ( StringFuncs::nullOrWhitespace( $autoCorePluginsRootDir ) )
-\t{
-\t\t# No plugin directory configured.
-\t\treturn ();
-\t}
-
-\tmy @allPluginDirs = FileUtil::getAllDirsInTree(
-\t\t$autoCorePluginsRootDir,
-\t\t1,   # <- max depth,
-\t\tTRUE # <- exlude root directory itself
-\t);
-
-\t$dbgLogger->print( sub {
-\t\treturn sprintf(
-\t\t\t"Found the following %u AutoCore plugin directories in \\"%s\\":\
\
\\t%s\
",
-\t\t\tscalar( @allPluginDirs ),
-\t\t\t$autoCorePluginsRootDir,
-\t\t\tjoin( "\
\\t", @allPluginDirs )
-\t\t);
-\t} );
-
-\tmy @metaInfManifestPathComponents = ( \'META-INF\', \'MANIFEST.MF\' );
-
-\tforeach my $pluginDir ( @allPluginDirs )
-\t{
-\t\tmy $manifestFilePath = FileUtil::join( $pluginDir, @metaInfManifestPathComponents );
-
-\t\tif ( ! -f $manifestFilePath )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] AutoCore plugin directory \\"%s\\" does not have a %s file!\
",
-\t\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t\t$pluginDir,
-\t\t\t\tFileUtil::join( @metaInfManifestPathComponents )
-\t\t\t);
-\t\t}
-
-\t\tif ( -z $manifestFilePath )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] AutoCore plugin directory \\"%s\\" has an empty %s file!\
",
-\t\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t\t$pluginDir,
-\t\t\t\tFileUtil::join( @metaInfManifestPathComponents )
-\t\t\t);
-\t\t}
-\t}
-
-\treturn @allPluginDirs;
-}
-
-# Returns a list containing the path names of any files and directories that should be excluded
-# from the cross-check between the local config and the config used to build an AUTOSAR archive.
-#
-# Note that some of the files / dirs excluded via this blacklist may be overridden by the whitelist
-# returned by __getCrossCheckWhitelist.
-sub __filesAndDirsThatShouldAlwaysBeBlacklisted($%)
-{
-\tmy ( $dbgLogger, %autosarConfigDictionary ) = @_;
-
-\tmy @alwaysBlacklistThese = ();
-
-\tmy $projects = $autosarConfigDictionary{ \'projects\' };
-
-\tforeach my $thisProject ( @$projects )
-\t{
-\t\tmy $projectDirectory = $$thisProject{ \'projectDirectoryPath\' };
-
-\t\t# Ignore any files in the project\'s output tree.
-\t\tmy $outputDir = FileUtil::join(
-\t\t\t$projectDirectory,
-\t\t\tComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::Base::REL_OUTPUT_GENERATED_PATH_LIST
-\t\t);
-
-\t\tpush( @alwaysBlacklistThese, $outputDir );
-
-\t\t# The projects\' preferences files are generated files (as we create them as copies of the
-\t\t# preferences template files) and hence build results, not inputs.
-\t\tmy $preferencesFile = $$thisProject{ \'preferencesFile\' };
-
-\t\tif ( ! StringFuncs::null( $preferencesFile ) )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tpush( @alwaysBlacklistThese, $preferencesFile );
-\t\t}
-\t}
-
-\tpush(
-\t\t@alwaysBlacklistThese,
-\t\t@{ $autosarConfigDictionary{ \'ARCHIVE_WATCH_ADDITIONAL_EXCLUDES\' } }
-\t);
-
-\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t"Always blacklisting these files and directories (%u):\
\
\\t%s\
",
-\t\tscalar( @alwaysBlacklistThese ),
-\t\tjoin( "\
\\t", sort( @alwaysBlacklistThese ) )
-\t);
-
-\treturn @alwaysBlacklistThese;
-}
-
-# Returns a list of all files that have an effect on the AUTOSAR build results.
-#
-## @todo We should probably incorporate the Tresos Studio tool itself! If the Tresos Studio version
-## changes, any archive that would otherwise match the configuration should probably be regarded
-## as obsolete.
-sub __determineAllConfigFiles($%)
-{
-\tmy ( $dbgLogger, %autosarConfigDictionary ) = @_;
-
-\tmy $startTime = Time::HiRes::time();
-
-\tmy ( $filesToHash, $searchRegEx ) = __getConfigFileCombinations(
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t%autosarConfigDictionary
-\t);
-
-\tmy @blacklist = __filesAndDirsThatShouldAlwaysBeBlacklisted(
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t%autosarConfigDictionary
-\t);
-
-\tmy @whitelist = __getCrossCheckWhitelist( $dbgLogger, %autosarConfigDictionary );
-
-\tmy @nonPluginConfigFiles = FileUtil::catalogFilesWithBlacklist(
-\t\t\\@blacklist,
-\t\t\\@whitelist,
-\t\t$filesToHash,
-\t\t$searchRegEx,
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t\'parallel\' => TRUE
-\t);
-
-\tpush( @nonPluginConfigFiles, $autosarConfigDictionary{ \'TRESOS_BATCH_FILE\' } );
-
-\t# Get a list of the various AutoCore plugins\' root directories. Unlike with the other
-\t# directories, where we\'ll only include AUTOSAR configuration files in the file digest
-\t# comparison, with AutoCore plugins we will look at ANY AND ALL files. For instance, a plugin
-\t# may also contain C code and makefiles, and these would not be detected if we only checked for
-\t# AUTOSAR configuration files.
-\tmy @autoCorePluginDirs = __getAutoCorePluginDirs(
-\t\t$autosarConfigDictionary{ \'AUTOCORE_PLUGINS_ROOT\' },
-\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t);
-
-\tmy @autoCorePluginFiles = FileUtil::catalogFiles(
-\t\t\\@autoCorePluginDirs,
-\t\tundef,
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t\'parallel\' => TRUE
-\t);
-
-\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\'Found %u files in %u AutoCore plugin directories.\',
-\t\tscalar( @autoCorePluginFiles ),
-\t\tscalar( @autoCorePluginDirs )
-\t);
-
-\t$dbgLogger->print( sub {
-\t\tmy @combinations = __combineListEntries(
-\t\t\t$filesToHash,
-\t\t\t[ map { "/*.$_" } AUTOSAR_CONFIG_FILE_TYPES ],
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t);
-
-\t\treturn sprintf(
-\t\t\t"Will compute %s file hashes for these directory / file-type " .
-\t\t\t\t"combinations (%u) (plus all AutoCore plugin files):\
\
\\t%s\
",
-\t\t\tHASH_TYPE,
-\t\t\tscalar( @combinations ),
-\t\t\tjoin( "\
\\t", sort( @combinations ) )
-\t\t);
-\t} );
-
-\tmy @resultList = ( @nonPluginConfigFiles, @autoCorePluginFiles );
-
-\tmy $duration = Time::HiRes::time() - $startTime;
-
-\tprintf(
-\t\t"NOTE: %s Took %u.%03u seconds to gather list of all config files that may affect build in " .
-\t\t\t"workspace (list has %u entries).\
",
-\t\tContext::getTimeStampWithSubject( ComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::Base::INFO_MESSAGE_SUBJECT ),
-\t\t$duration,
-\t\t( $duration - int( $duration ) ) * 1000,
-\t\tscalar( @resultList )
-\t);
-
-\treturn @resultList;
-}
-
-# Returns a list of all subdirectories of the AUTOSAR workspace that should be placed in the
-# AUTOSAR archive.
-sub __getWorkspaceDirsToArchive($$%)
-{
-\tmy ( $importantPaths, $dbgLogger, %autosarConfigDictionary ) = @_;
-
-\tmy %directoryMap =
-\tComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::Base::get_TRESOS_directories(
-\t\tComponentBuildModules::PathConfig::getAutomaticPath(
-\t\t\t$importantPaths,
-\t\t\t\'COMPONENT_ROOT\',
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t),
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t%autosarConfigDictionary
-\t);
-
-\tmy $generateInfoDict = $directoryMap{ \'generate\' };
-\tmy @dirsToArchive = values( %$generateInfoDict );
-\treturn FileUtil::reduceFileSystemTraversalList( \\@dirsToArchive );
-}
-
-sub __getAutosarBuildInfoStringForArchiveBundle($$$$$%)
-{
-\tmy (
-\t\t$importantPaths,
-\t\t$optionsDictionary,
-\t\t$dynamicVariableReader,
-\t\t$buildProgessInfoDict,
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t%autosarConfigDictionary
-\t) = @_;
-
-\tmy $infoString = sprintf(
-\t\t"The tools/cm version was %s.\
" .
-\t\t"The tools/CmPlatform version was %s.\
",
-\t\t$dynamicVariableReader->getValue( \'CM_VERSION\' ),
-\t\t$dynamicVariableReader->getValue( \'CM_PLATFORM_VERSION\' )
-\t);
-
-\tmy @buildOptionNames = sort( keys( %$optionsDictionary ) );
-
-\tif ( @buildOptionNames )
-\t{
-\t\t$infoString .= sprintf(
-\t\t\t"\
The following %u build options were in play:\
\
",
-\t\t\tscalar( @buildOptionNames )
-\t\t);
-
-\t\tforeach my $buildOptionName ( @buildOptionNames )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tmy $value = $$optionsDictionary{ $buildOptionName };
-
-\t\t\t$infoString .= sprintf(
-\t\t\t\t"\\t--%s => %s\
",
-\t\t\t\t$buildOptionName,
-\t\t\t\tdefined( $value ) ? "\'$value\'" : \'<undef>\'
-\t\t\t);
-\t\t}
-\t}
-\telse
-\t{
-\t\t$infoString .= "\
No build options were specified.\
";
-\t}
-
-\tlocal( $Data::Dumper::Sortkeys ) = 1;
-
-\t$infoString .= sprintf(
-\t\t"\
Full dump of AUTOSAR config dictionary (%u entries):\
\
%s\
\
",
-\t\tscalar( keys( %autosarConfigDictionary ) ),
-\t\tData::Dumper::Dumper( \\%autosarConfigDictionary )
-\t);
-
-\tmy (
-\t\t$automaticPathVariableListString,
-\t\t$numberOfEntries
-\t) = ComponentBuildModules::PathConfig::printAutomaticPathVariables(
-\t\t\'\',
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t%$importantPaths
-\t);
-
-\t$infoString .= sprintf(
-\t\t"The following %u symbolic paths were configured:\
\
%s\
",
-\t\t$numberOfEntries,
-\t\t$automaticPathVariableListString
-\t);
-
-\tmy $duration = $$buildProgessInfoDict{ \'duration\' };
-
-\tif ( defined( $duration ) )
-\t{
-\t\t$infoString .= sprintf(
-\t\t\t"\
The AUTOSAR build took %u.%03u seconds to complete.\
",
-\t\t\t$duration,
-\t\t\t( $duration - int( $duration ) ) * 1000
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\tmy $workspaceLockedByOtherProcess = $$buildProgessInfoDict{ \'workspaceLockedByOtherProcess\' };
-
-\t$infoString .= sprintf(
-\t\t"The AUTOSAR workspace %s to be locked by an external process when the AUTOSAR build " .
-\t\t\t"began.\
",
-\t\t$workspaceLockedByOtherProcess ? \'seemed\' : \'did not appear\'
-\t);
-
-\t$infoString .= "\
";
-
-\treturn $infoString;
-}
-
-# Returns a list of absolute path names of any AUTOSAR build inputs that may themselves be modified
-# by the AUTOSAR build.
-# In an ideal world, something like this would never happen. Sadly, this isn\'t an ideal world, and
-# so we have to deal with, for instance, SystemModel tbd files that get modified by the AUTOSAR
-# build.
-sub __getMutableInputs($%)
-{
-\tmy ( $dbgLogger, %autosarConfigDictionary ) = @_;
-
-\tmy @mutableInputs = ();
-
-\tmy $projects = $autosarConfigDictionary{ \'projects\' };
-
-\tforeach my $thisProject ( @$projects )
-\t{
-\t\tmy $mutableInputsInThisProject = $$thisProject{ \'mutableInputs\' };
-\t\tassert( defined( $mutableInputsInThisProject ) );
-\t\tpush( @mutableInputs, @$mutableInputsInThisProject );
-\t}
-
-\treturn @mutableInputs;
-}
-
-sub __updateAutosarArchiveAndWorkspace($$$$$%)
-{
-\tmy (
-\t\t$optionsDictionary,
-\t\t$importantPaths,
-\t\t$dynamicVariableReader,
-\t\t$forceRebuild,
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t%autosarConfigDictionary
-\t) = @_;
-
-\tmy $startTime = Time::HiRes::time();
-
-\tmy @dirsToArchive = __getWorkspaceDirsToArchive(
-\t\t$importantPaths,
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t%autosarConfigDictionary
-\t);
-
-\tmy $duration = Time::HiRes::time() - $startTime;
-
-\tprintf(
-\t\t"NOTE: %s Took %u.%03u seconds to get list of workspace subdirectories to archive (list " .
-\t\t\t"has %u entries).\
",
-\t\tContext::getTimeStampWithSubject( ComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::Base::INFO_MESSAGE_SUBJECT ),
-\t\t$duration,
-\t\t( $duration - int( $duration ) ) * 1000,
-\t\tscalar( @dirsToArchive )
-\t);
-
-\tmy $mkTempDir = ComponentBuildModules::PathConfig::getAutomaticPath(
-\t\t$importantPaths,
-\t\t\'MK_TEMP_DIR\',
-\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t);
-
-\t# This dictionary is populated with diagnostic information when rebuild_AUTOSAR executes.
-\t# The information added to the dictionary is then used when
-\t# __getAutosarBuildInfoStringForArchiveBundle runs.
-\tmy %buildProgessInfoDict = ();
-
-\tmy %behavior = (
-\t\t\'hashType\' => HASH_TYPE(),
-
-\t\t\'forceRebuild\' => $forceRebuild,
-
-\t\t\'infoFunc\' => sub {
-\t\t\treturn __getAutosarBuildInfoStringForArchiveBundle(
-\t\t\t\t$importantPaths,
-\t\t\t\t$optionsDictionary,
-\t\t\t\t$dynamicVariableReader,
-\t\t\t\t\\%buildProgessInfoDict,
-\t\t\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t\t\t%autosarConfigDictionary
-\t\t\t);
-\t\t},
-
-\t\t# Any path names mentioned in any files in an archive must be made relative with regard
-\t\t# to this base path. The reason for this is that Tresos Studio puts absolute paths in many
-\t\t# of the files it generates. For these files to be usable across file systems, we need to
-\t\t# relativize them in the archive (and then later convert them back to absolute paths when
-\t\t# actually using the archive).
-\t\t\'anchor\' => ComponentBuildModules::PathConfig::getAutomaticPath(
-\t\t\t$importantPaths,
-\t\t\t\'REPO_ROOT\',
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t),
-
-\t\t\'messageSubject\' => \'AUTOSAR archive\',
-
-\t\t\'buildLogFileName\' => \'workspaceBuildLog.txt\',
-
-\t\t\'tempDir\' => FileUtil::join( $mkTempDir, \'autosarArchive\' )
-\t);
-
-\tmy $sharedArchiveStorageDir = $autosarConfigDictionary{ \'SHARED_ARCHIVE_STORAGE_DIR\' };
-\tassert( ! StringFuncs::nullOrWhitespace( $sharedArchiveStorageDir ) );
-
-\tmy $localArchiveStorageDir = $autosarConfigDictionary{ \'LOCAL_ARCHIVE_STORAGE_DIR\' };
-\tassert( ! StringFuncs::nullOrWhitespace( $localArchiveStorageDir ) );
-
-\tmy @mutableInputs = __getMutableInputs( $dbgLogger, %autosarConfigDictionary );
-
-\tFileUtil::ArchivedWorkspace::update(
-\t\t$sharedArchiveStorageDir,
-\t\t$localArchiveStorageDir,
-
-\t\t# The actual AUTOSAR build function.
-\t\tUserFunctor::curry(
-\t\t\t\\&ComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::RebuildWorkspace::rebuild_AUTOSAR,
-\t\t\t$importantPaths,
-\t\t\t\\%buildProgessInfoDict,
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t\t%autosarConfigDictionary
-\t\t),
-
-\t\t# The paths of all AUTOSAR input / config files. We consider as input files any and all
-\t\t# files that may have an effect on the results of the AUTOSAR build.
-\t\t[ __determineAllConfigFiles( $dbgLogger, %autosarConfigDictionary ) ],
-
-\t\t\\@mutableInputs,
-
-\t\t# The root of the workspace in which to build (workspace here refers to what is considered
-\t\t# a workspace by the FileUtil::ArchivedWorkspace module, not to the actual Tresos workspaces).
-\t\t$autosarConfigDictionary{ \'TRESOS_WORKSPACE_ROOT\' },
-
-\t\t# The relative (WRT the workspace root) paths of any directories to place into the archive.
-\t\t[ map {
-\t\t\tFile::Spec->abs2rel( $_, $autosarConfigDictionary{ \'TRESOS_WORKSPACE_ROOT\' } )
-\t\t} @dirsToArchive ],
-
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t%behavior
-\t);
-}
-
-# Returns 2 booleans:
-#
-# 0) True if use of the archive feature is disabled, regardless of whether this was done via a user
-#    option or via a permanent configuration setting.
-#
-# 1) True if the use of the archive feature was disabled explicitly via a user option, but not via
-#    a permanent configuration setting.
-sub __useOfArchiveFeatureDisabled($$%)
-{
-\tmy ( $optionsDictionary, $dbgLogger, %autosarConfigDictionary ) = @_;
-
-\tmy $ignoreAutosarArchiveOptionUsed = $$optionsDictionary{ ComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::Base::OPT_NAME_IGNORE_ARCHIVE() };
-
-\tmy $disabledInConfig = StringFuncs::null( $autosarConfigDictionary{ \'SHARED_ARCHIVE_STORAGE_DIR\' } );
-
-\tif ( $disabledInConfig )
-\t{
-\t\tprintf(
-\t\t\t"WARNING: [%s] Use of archive feature explicitly disabled in component configuration!\
",
-\t\t\tComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::Base::INFO_MESSAGE_SUBJECT
-\t\t);
-\t}
-\telsif ( $ignoreAutosarArchiveOptionUsed )
-\t{
-\t\tprintf(
-\t\t\t"NOTE: [%s] Use of archive feature disabled via user option --%s.\
",
-\t\t\tComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::Base::INFO_MESSAGE_SUBJECT,
-\t\t\tComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::Base::OPT_NAME_IGNORE_ARCHIVE
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\treturn (
-\t\t$disabledInConfig || $ignoreAutosarArchiveOptionUsed,
-\t\t$ignoreAutosarArchiveOptionUsed && ! $disabledInConfig
-\t);
-}
-
-sub getMirrorRulesFor_OEM_BE($$)
-{
-\tmy ( $self, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tmy %finalAutosarConfig = __getFinal_AUTOSAR_config( $self, $dbgLogger );
-
-\t# If the OEM-BE should allow the customer to actually modify the AUTOSAR configuration itself,
-\t# we need to add all the AUTOSAR-relevant stuff to the OEM-BE.
-\tif ( ! $finalAutosarConfig{ \'buildIn_OEM_BE\' } )
-\t{
-\t\t$dbgLogger->print( \'AUTOSAR build not enabled in OEM-BE.\' );
-\t\treturn ();
-\t}
-
-\tmy $tresosRootDir = $finalAutosarConfig{ \'TRESOS_ROOT_FOLDER\' };
-\tassert( ! StringFuncs::null( $tresosRootDir ) );
-
-\tmy $workspaceComponentRoot = $finalAutosarConfig{ \'TRESOS_WORKSPACE_ROOT\' };
-\tassert( ! StringFuncs::null( $workspaceComponentRoot ) );
-
-\tmy $autoCorePluginsRoot = $finalAutosarConfig{ \'AUTOCORE_PLUGINS_ROOT\' };
-\tassert( ! StringFuncs::null( $autoCorePluginsRoot ) );
-
-\t## @todo Exclude output files / dirs in project workspace(s)! Not critical since
-\t## they will get overwritten anyway when the AUTOSAR build runs (either by copying
-\t## from the AUTOSAR archive or by generating them anew), but it would help save
-\t## some space.
-\treturn (
-\t\t$tresosRootDir          => TRUE(),
-\t\t$workspaceComponentRoot => TRUE(),
-\t\t$autoCorePluginsRoot    => TRUE()
-\t);
-}
-
-sub makeSureWorkspaceIsReady($$$$%)
-{
-\tmy ( $self, $buildEnvType, $componentName, $dbgLogger, %optionsDictionary ) = @_;
-
-\tmy $startTime = Time::HiRes::time();
-
-\tif ( ! __useOf_AUTOSAR_principallyEnabled( $self, $buildEnvType, $componentName, $dbgLogger ) )
-\t{
-\t\treturn;
-\t}
-
-\tmy %finalAutosarConfig = __getFinal_AUTOSAR_config( $self, $dbgLogger );
-
-\tmy (
-\t\t$useOfArchiveFeatureDisabled,
-\t\t$useOfArchivePrimarilyDisabledViaUserOption
-\t) = __useOfArchiveFeatureDisabled( \\%optionsDictionary, $dbgLogger, %finalAutosarConfig );
-
-\tmy $importantPaths = __getImportantPathsDict( $self );
-
-\tif ( $useOfArchiveFeatureDisabled )
-\t{
-\t\t# Use of archive feature is not allowed -> just rebuild workspace, but do not archive it.
-\t\t#
-\t\t# Note that even when --OPT_NAME_IGNORE_ARCHIVE is used, we\'ll avoid rebuilding if at least
-\t\t# the required output directories already exist. Obviously, this says nothing about whether
-\t\t# these directories also contain all of the required files and thus shouldn\'t be seen as
-\t\t# water-tight proof that everything is in order. If we really wanted to be 100% on the safe
-\t\t# side, we _should_ always rebuild when --OPT_NAME_IGNORE_ARCHIVE is specified, but when I
-\t\t# actually changed the build behavior to use that strategy, I received a lot of complaints
-\t\t# from disgruntled AUTOSAR developers, so I had to change it back to this less-safe but
-\t\t# commonly expected behavior.
-
-\t\tmy $canAvoidRebuild = ComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::RebuildWorkspace::checkIfGeneratedFilesAreComplete(
-\t\t\t$importantPaths,
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t\t%finalAutosarConfig
-\t\t);
-
-\t\tif ( $canAvoidRebuild )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tprintf(
-\t\t\t\t"NOTE: [%s] Not rebuilding AUTOSAR since all expected output directories " .
-\t\t\t\t\t"already exist.\
",
-\t\t\t\tComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::Base::INFO_MESSAGE_SUBJECT
-\t\t\t);
-\t\t}
-\t\telse
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::RebuildWorkspace::rebuild_AUTOSAR(
-\t\t\t\t$importantPaths,
-\t\t\t\tundef,
-\t\t\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t\t\t%finalAutosarConfig
-\t\t\t);
-\t\t}
-\t}
-\telse
-\t{
-\t\t__updateAutosarArchiveAndWorkspace(
-\t\t\t\\%optionsDictionary,
-\t\t\t$importantPaths,
-\t\t\t__getDynamicVarsReader( $self ),
-\t\t\tFALSE,
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t\t%finalAutosarConfig
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\tmy $duration = Time::HiRes::time() - $startTime;
-
-\tmy $shouldAdvertiseNoArchiveOption = ! $useOfArchiveFeatureDisabled && ! $useOfArchivePrimarilyDisabledViaUserOption;
-
-\t# advertise existence of OPT_NAME_IGNORE_ARCHIVE option if the user didn\'t specify the
-\t# option
-\tmy $messageAboutNoArchiveOption = $shouldAdvertiseNoArchiveOption ?
-\t\tsprintf(
-\t\t\t\' (if you\\\'re sure your AUTOSAR workspace is already up-to-date, you can use the \' .
-\t\t\t\t\'--%s option to accelerate this step)\',
-\t\t\tComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::Base::OPT_NAME_IGNORE_ARCHIVE
-\t\t) :
-\t\t\'\';
-
-\tprintf(
-\t\t"NOTE: %s Took %u.%03u seconds to set up AUTOSAR%s.\
",
-\t\tContext::getTimeStampWithSubject( ComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::Base::INFO_MESSAGE_SUBJECT ),
-\t\t$duration,
-\t\t( $duration - int( $duration ) ) * 1000,
-\t\t$messageAboutNoArchiveOption
-\t);
-}
-
-sub __obtainFinal_AUTOSAR_config($$$%)
-{
-\tmy ( $importantPaths, $variantPath, $dbgLogger, %parsedAutosarConfig ) = @_;
-
-\t# And then use that raw information to create the final, fully processed configuration.
-\tmy %finalAutosarConfig = __processParsed_AUTOSAR_configDict(
-\t\t$importantPaths,
-\t\t$variantPath,
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t%parsedAutosarConfig
-\t);
-
-\t$dbgLogger->print( sub {
-\t\tlocal( $Data::Dumper::Sortkeys ) = 1;
-\t\treturn sprintf(
-\t\t\t"Final content of AUTOSAR configuration dictionary:\
\
%s\
",
-\t\t\tData::Dumper::Dumper( \\%finalAutosarConfig )
-\t\t);
-\t} );
-
-\treturn %finalAutosarConfig;
-}
-
-sub __processParsed_AUTOSAR_configDict($$$%)
-{
-\tmy ( $importantPaths, $variantPath, $dbgLogger, %parsedAutosarConfig ) = @_;
-
-\tif ( ! keys( %parsedAutosarConfig ) )
-\t{
-\t\t$dbgLogger->print(
-\t\t\t\'Component not using AUTOSAR at all (not configured in component config file).\'
-\t\t);
-
-\t\treturn %parsedAutosarConfig;
-\t}
-
-\tmy %finalAutosarConfig = %parsedAutosarConfig;
-
-\t__processParsedProjectConfigurations( \\%finalAutosarConfig, $variantPath, $dbgLogger );
-
-\tmy $localArchiveStorageDir = FileUtil::join(
-\t\tEnv::getUserSpecificTempDir( $dbgLogger ),
-\t\t\'localAutosarArchiveStorage\'
-\t);
-
-\t$finalAutosarConfig{ \'LOCAL_ARCHIVE_STORAGE_DIR\' } = $localArchiveStorageDir;
-
-\tmy $autoCoreRoot = FileUtil::join(
-\t\t ComponentBuildModules::PathConfig::getAutomaticPath(
-\t\t\t$importantPaths,
-\t\t\t\'EXTERNAL_MODULES_ROOT\',
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t),
-\t\t\'AutoCore\'
-\t);
-
-\t$finalAutosarConfig{ \'AUTOCORE_ROOT\' } = $autoCoreRoot;
-
-\tmy $autoCorePluginsRoot = FileUtil::join( $autoCoreRoot, \'eclipse\', \'plugins\' );
-\t$finalAutosarConfig{ \'AUTOCORE_PLUGINS_ROOT\' } = $autoCorePluginsRoot;
-
-\treturn %finalAutosarConfig;
-}
-
-sub __processParsedProjectConfigurations($$$)
-{
-\tmy ( $finalAutosarConfig, $variantPath, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tmy $autosarProjectDictionaries = $$finalAutosarConfig{ \'projects\' };
-
-\tif ( ! defined( $autosarProjectDictionaries ) || ! @$autosarProjectDictionaries )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] AUTOSAR configuration dictionary parsed from component config does not " .
-\t\t\t\t"contain any project configurations!\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext()
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\tforeach my $thisProject ( @$autosarProjectDictionaries )
-\t{
-\t\tmy $nameOfThisProject = $$thisProject{ \'name\' };
-\t\tassert( ! StringFuncs::null( $nameOfThisProject ) );
-
-\t\tif ( ! exists( $$finalAutosarConfig{ \'MAIN_PROJECT_NAME\' } ) )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\t$$finalAutosarConfig{ \'MAIN_PROJECT_NAME\' } = $nameOfThisProject;
-\t\t}
-
-\t\tmy $workspaceRoot = $$finalAutosarConfig{ \'TRESOS_WORKSPACE_ROOT\' };
-\t\tassert( ! StringFuncs::null( $workspaceRoot ) );
-
-\t\tmy $projectDirectoryPath = __getWorkspaceDirectoryPath(
-\t\t\t$workspaceRoot,
-\t\t\t$nameOfThisProject,
-\t\t\t$variantPath,
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t);
-
-\t\t$$thisProject{ \'projectDirectoryPath\' } = $projectDirectoryPath;
-
-\t\tmy $systemModelFile = __findSystemModelFile( $projectDirectoryPath, $dbgLogger );
-
-\t\tif ( ! StringFuncs::null( $systemModelFile ) )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\t$$thisProject{ \'systemModelFile\' } = $systemModelFile;
-\t\t}
-
-\t\tmy $preferencesTemplateFile = FileUtil::join(
-\t\t\t$projectDirectoryPath,
-\t\t\t\'.prefs\',
-\t\t\t\'preferences_template.xdm\'
-\t\t);
-
-\t\t# Some projects do not have a preferences template file.
-\t\tif ( -r $preferencesTemplateFile )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tmy $preferencesFile = FileUtil::join(
-\t\t\t\t$projectDirectoryPath,
-\t\t\t\t\'.prefs\',
-\t\t\t\t\'preferences.xdm\'
-\t\t\t);
-
-\t\t\t$$thisProject{ \'preferencesFile\' } = $preferencesFile;
-\t\t\t$$thisProject{ \'preferencesTemplateFile\' } = $preferencesTemplateFile;
-\t\t}
-
-\t\t# The path names in mutableInputs are initially just relative paths (relative
-\t\t# to the workspace directory of this project). Convert them to absolute paths.
-\t\tmy $mutableInputs = $$thisProject{ \'mutableInputs\' };
-
-\t\t@$mutableInputs = map { FileUtil::join( $projectDirectoryPath, $_ ) } @$mutableInputs;
-\t}
-}
-
-sub export_AUTOSAR_configToEclipse_IDE($$)
-{
-\tmy ( $self, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::RebuildWorkspace::importToolConfig(
-\t\tComponentBuildModules::PathConfig::getAutomaticPath(
-\t\t\t__getImportantPathsDict( $self ),
-\t\t\t\'COMPONENT_ROOT\',
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t),
-\t\tundef,
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t__getFinal_AUTOSAR_config( $self, $dbgLogger )
-\t);
-}
-
-sub __create_TRESOS_licenseFile($$%)
-{
-\tmy ( $licenseServerAddress, $dbgLogger, %autosarConfigDictionary ) = @_;
-
-\tassert( ! StringFuncs::null( $autosarConfigDictionary{ \'TRESOS_BIN_DIR\' } ) );
-
-\tmy $flexLM_config = FileUtil::join(
-\t\t$autosarConfigDictionary{ \'TRESOS_BIN_DIR\' },
-\t\t\'flexlm.cfg\'
-\t);
-
-\tassert( ! StringFuncs::null( $licenseServerAddress ) );
-\t$licenseServerAddress = StringFuncs::trim( $licenseServerAddress );
-\tassert( ! StringFuncs::null( $licenseServerAddress ) );
-
-\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\'Creating Tresos license file "%s" (license server address: %s).\',
-\t\t$flexLM_config,
-\t\t$licenseServerAddress
-\t);
-
-\tFileUtil::writeTextFile( $flexLM_config, "$licenseServerAddress\
", $dbgLogger );
-}
-
-sub performSetup($$$$$$$$)
-{
-\tmy (
-\t\t$self,
-\t\t$buildEnvType,
-\t\t$componentName,
-\t\t$licenseConfigReader_lazy,
-\t\t$configAttributeSuffix,
-\t\t$dynamicVarsWriter,
-\t\t$compilerToolChainName,
-\t\t$linkerMapFile,
-\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t) = @_;
-
-\tif ( ! __useOf_AUTOSAR_principallyEnabled( $self, $buildEnvType, $componentName, $dbgLogger ) )
-\t{
-\t\treturn;
-\t}
-
-\tmy $fullLicenseKeyName = TRESOS_LICENSE_ADDRESS_KEY;
-
-\t# Only inject an underscore char if the string doesn\'t already end on one.
-\tif ( $fullLicenseKeyName !~ m/_$/ )
-\t{
-\t\t$fullLicenseKeyName .= \'_\';
-\t}
-
-\t$fullLicenseKeyName .= $configAttributeSuffix;
-
-\t$dbgLogger->printf( \'Querying project config for entry %s.\', $fullLicenseKeyName );
-
-\tmy $licenseConfigReader = $licenseConfigReader_lazy->getTheThing();
-
-\tmy $licenseServerAddress;
-
-\teval {
-\t\t$licenseServerAddress = $licenseConfigReader->getRequiredAttribute( $fullLicenseKeyName );
-\t\t1;
-\t} or do {
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"\
\
ERROR: [%s] Failed to set up license for Elektrobit Tresos tool chain (config " .
-\t\t\t\t"attribute suffix was \\"%s\\")! %s\
\
" .
-\t\t\t\t"Just in case this error was caused by some other phenomenon, here is the original " .
-\t\t\t\t"exception message:\
\
%s\
\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t$configAttributeSuffix,
-\t\t\tCommon::get_COMPUTER_SITE_NAME_notSetWarning(),
-\t\t\t$@
-\t\t);
-\t};
-
-\tmy %finalAutosarConfig = __getFinal_AUTOSAR_config( $self, $dbgLogger );
-
-\t# We create the license file even before we know whether we need to actually run an AUTOSAR
-\t# build. The reason for this is that the user wishing to use the Tresos Studio IDE will also
-\t# need this license file.
-\tassert( ! StringFuncs::null( $licenseServerAddress ) );
-\t__create_TRESOS_licenseFile( $licenseServerAddress, $dbgLogger, %finalAutosarConfig );
-
-\tif ( defined( $dynamicVarsWriter ) )
-\t{
-\t\t__export_AUTOSAR_env( $dynamicVarsWriter, $dbgLogger, %finalAutosarConfig );
-
-\t\tmy @additionalIncludeDirsForCompiler = __gatherAdditionalIncludeDirs(
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t\t%finalAutosarConfig
-\t\t);
-
-\t\t@additionalIncludeDirsForCompiler = sort( @additionalIncludeDirsForCompiler );
-
-\t\t$dbgLogger->print( sub {
-\t\t\treturn sprintf(
-\t\t\t\t"Got %u paths in \\@additionalIncludeDirsForCompiler:\
\
\\t%s\
",
-\t\t\t\tscalar( @additionalIncludeDirsForCompiler ),
-\t\t\t\tjoin( "\
\\t", @additionalIncludeDirsForCompiler )
-\t\t\t);
-\t\t} );
-
-\t\tassert( @additionalIncludeDirsForCompiler );
-\t\t#Setting the additional include dirs for compiler to empty as it is messing with compilation
-\t\t@additionalIncludeDirsForCompiler =();
-
-\t\t$dynamicVarsWriter->addVariable(
-\t\t\t\'ADDITIONAL_AUTOSAR_INCLUDE_DIRS\',
-\t\t\tjoin( \' \', @additionalIncludeDirsForCompiler )
-\t\t);
-
-\t\t# Elektrobit Tresos Studio references these symbols in some of its makefiles. Also, beware
-\t\t# that the $compilerToolChainName and $linkerMapFile arguments may be empty / undef. This
-\t\t# happens if, for instance, --rebuildAutosar, --setUpAutosar or --exportAutosar are used,
-\t\t# because these don\'t require compiler tool chains (meaning any compiler-specific setup
-\t\t# is skipped).
-\t\tif ( ! StringFuncs::null( $compilerToolChainName ) )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\t$dynamicVarsWriter->addVariable( \'TOOLCHAIN\', $compilerToolChainName, TRUE );
-\t\t}
-
-\t\tif ( ! StringFuncs::null( $linkerMapFile ) )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\t$dynamicVarsWriter->addVariable( \'MAP_FILE\', $linkerMapFile, TRUE );
-\t\t}
-\t}
-}
-
-sub __gatherAdditionalIncludeDirs($%)
-{
-\tmy ( $dbgLogger, %autosarConfigDictionary ) = @_;
-
-\tmy @includeDirs = ();
-
-\t# Add the output/generated directories of the various AUTOSAR projects.
-\tmy $projects = $autosarConfigDictionary{ \'projects\' };
-
-\tforeach my $project ( @$projects )
-\t{
-\t\tmy $projectDirectoryPath = $$project{ \'projectDirectoryPath\' };
-\t\tassert( ! StringFuncs::null( $projectDirectoryPath ) );
-
-\t\tmy $generatedDir = FileUtil::join(
-\t\t\t$projectDirectoryPath,
-\t\t\tComponentBuildModules::AutosarLib::Base::REL_OUTPUT_GENERATED_PATH_LIST
-\t\t);
-
-\t\t$dbgLogger->printf( \'Considering directory "%s".\', $generatedDir );
-
-\t\tif ( ! -d $generatedDir )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\t\t\'Considered directory "%s" is not actually a directory (or it simply does not \' .
-\t\t\t\t\t\'exist at all).\',
-\t\t\t\t$generatedDir
-\t\t\t);
-
-\t\t\tnext;
-\t\t}
-
-\t\tforeach my $incDirName ( INCLUDE_DIR_BASE_NAMES )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tmy $incDirPath = FileUtil::join( $generatedDir, $incDirName );
-
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger->printf( \'Considering directory "%s".\', $incDirPath );
-
-\t\t\tif ( ! -d $incDirPath )
-\t\t\t{
-\t\t\t\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\t\t\t\'Considered directory "%s" is not actually a directory (or it simply does not \' .
-\t\t\t\t\t\t\'exist at all).\',
-\t\t\t\t\t$incDirPath
-\t\t\t\t);
-
-\t\t\t\tnext;
-\t\t\t}
-
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\t\t\'Adding considered directory "%s" to list of include dirs.\',
-\t\t\t\t$incDirPath
-\t\t\t);
-
-\t\t\tpush( @includeDirs, $incDirPath );
-\t\t}
-\t}
-
-\t# And now the plugins\' include directories.
-\tmy $pluginsDirRoot = $autosarConfigDictionary{ \'AUTOCORE_PLUGINS_ROOT\' };
-
-\tif ( StringFuncs::null( $pluginsDirRoot ) )
-\t{
-\t\treturn @includeDirs;
-\t}
-
-\tmy @allPluginDirs = FileUtil::getAllDirsInTree(
-\t\t$pluginsDirRoot,
-\t\t1,   # <- max depth,
-\t\tTRUE # <- exlude root directory itself
-\t);
-
-\tforeach my $pluginDir ( @allPluginDirs )
-\t{
-\t\tforeach my $incDirName ( INCLUDE_DIR_BASE_NAMES )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tmy $incDirPath = FileUtil::join( $pluginDir, $incDirName );
-
-\t\t\tif ( ! -d $incDirPath )
-\t\t\t{
-\t\t\t\tnext;
-\t\t\t}
-
-\t\t\tpush( @includeDirs, $incDirPath );
-
-\t\t\t## @todo Also set up platform / compiler tool chain specific includes automatically!
-\t\t\t#my $platformAndCompilerSpecificIncludeDir = FileUtil::join(
-\t\t\t#\t$incDirPath,
-\t\t\t#\t$platform,
-\t\t\t#\t$compilerToolchain
-\t\t\t#);
-
-\t\t\t#if ( -d $platformAndCompilerSpecificIncludeDir )
-\t\t\t#{
-\t\t\t#\tpush( @includeDirs, $platformAndCompilerSpecificIncludeDir );
-\t\t\t#}
-\t\t}
-\t}
-
-\treturn @includeDirs;
-}
-
-sub set_OEM_AUTOSAR_preReleaseEnv($$$)
-{
-\tmy ( $self, $dynamicVarsWriter, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tmy %finalAutosarConfig = __getFinal_AUTOSAR_config( $self, $dbgLogger );
-
-\t# If the OEM-BE is supposed to include the AUTOSAR workspace (and not just the files generated
-\t# from the AUTOSAR workspace), we may also have to include additional header files from our
-\t# code base. Some AUTOSAR translation units pull in handwritten header files. The
-\t# $(COMPILABLE_AUTOSAR_FILE_SEARCH_DIRS) variable tells the script assembling these header
-\t# dependencies in which directories to search for such AUTOSAR translation units.
-\tif ( ! $finalAutosarConfig{ \'buildIn_OEM_BE\' } )
-\t{
-\t\treturn;
-\t}
-
-\tmy @searchTranslationUnitsHere = (
-\t\t$finalAutosarConfig{ \'AUTOCORE_PLUGINS_ROOT\' },
-\t\t$finalAutosarConfig{ \'TRESOS_WORKSPACE_ROOT\' }
-\t);
-
-\t@searchTranslationUnitsHere = grep { ! StringFuncs::null( $_ ) } @searchTranslationUnitsHere;
-\t@searchTranslationUnitsHere = grep { -d $_ } @searchTranslationUnitsHere;
-
-\tif ( ! @searchTranslationUnitsHere )
-\t{
-\t\treturn;
-\t}
-
-\t$dynamicVarsWriter->addVariable(
-\t\t\'COMPILABLE_AUTOSAR_FILE_SEARCH_DIRS\',
-\t\tjoin( \' \', @searchTranslationUnitsHere )
-\t);
-
-\tmy @compilableAutosarLibsAndObjectFiles = __get_AUTOSAR_libsAndObjsBuildableIn_OEM_BE(
-\t\t__getImportantPathsDict( $self ),
-\t\t$dynamicVarsWriter,
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t@searchTranslationUnitsHere
-\t);
-
-\tif ( @compilableAutosarLibsAndObjectFiles )
-\t{
-\t\t$dynamicVarsWriter->addVariable(
-\t\t\t\'COMPILABLE_AUTOSAR_LIBS_AND_OBJS\',
-\t\t\tjoin( \' \', @compilableAutosarLibsAndObjectFiles )
-\t\t);
-\t}
-}
-
-# Returns a list of any libaries and objects that are built from translation units that part of the
-# AUTOSAR workspace or of any AUTOSAR plugins.
-sub __get_AUTOSAR_libsAndObjsBuildableIn_OEM_BE($$$@)
-{
-\tmy ( $importantPaths, $makefileEnvGetter, $dbgLogger, @searchTranslationUnitsHere ) = @_;
-
-\tmy $dependencyDir = FileUtil::join(
-\t\tComponentBuildModules::PathConfig::getAutomaticPath(
-\t\t\t$importantPaths,
-\t\t\t\'OUTPUT_DIR\',
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t),
-\t\t\'depend\'
-\t);
-
-\tmy @allTranslationUnits = DependencyFiles::getAllFilesMentionedInDependencyFiles(
-\t\t$dependencyDir,
-\t\tTRUE,  # true means "throw if nothing found"
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\tDependencyFiles::C_CPP_TRANSLATION_UNIT_EXTENSIONS
-\t);
-
-\tmy @autosarTranslationUnits = grep {
-\t\tFileUtil::isSubPathOfAny( $_, \\@searchTranslationUnitsHere )
-\t} @allTranslationUnits;
-
-\t$dbgLogger->print( sub {
-\t\treturn sprintf(
-\t\t\t"Out of a total of %u translation units, %u are AUTOSAR translation units:\
\
%s\
",
-\t\t\tscalar( @allTranslationUnits ),
-\t\t\tscalar( @autosarTranslationUnits ),
-\t\t\tjoin( "\
\\t", @autosarTranslationUnits )
-\t\t);
-\t} );
-
-\tmy $objectRuleFile = $makefileEnvGetter->getValue( \'OBJECT_RULE_FILE\' );
-\tmy $libraryRuleFile = $makefileEnvGetter->getValue( \'STATIC_LIB_DEP_FILE\' );
-
-\treturn DependencyFiles::getLibsAndObjsBuiltFromTheseTranslationUnits(
-\t\t$objectRuleFile,
-\t\t$libraryRuleFile,
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t@autosarTranslationUnits
-\t);
-}
-
-sub __findSystemModelFile($$)
-{
-\tmy ( $projectDirectoryPath, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tif ( ! -d $projectDirectoryPath )
-\t{
-\t\tif ( -f $projectDirectoryPath )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] Project directory path \\"%s\\" refers to a file, not a directory!\
",
-\t\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t\t$projectDirectoryPath
-\t\t\t);
-\t\t}
-
-\t\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\t\'Will not search workspace directory "%s" for .tdb files because the directory \' .
-\t\t\t\t\'does not exist.\',
-\t\t\t$projectDirectoryPath
-\t\t);
-\t\treturn undef;
-\t}
-
-\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\'Searching workspace directory "%s" for .tdb files.\',
-\t\t$projectDirectoryPath
-\t);
-
-\tmy @allTdbFiles = FileUtil::catalogFiles( $projectDirectoryPath, qr{(?i).+\\.tdb$}, $dbgLogger );
-
-\tif ( ! @allTdbFiles )
-\t{
-\t\t$dbgLogger->printf( \'No .tdb files found in directory "%s".\', $projectDirectoryPath );
-
-\t\treturn undef;
-\t}
-
-\tif ( @allTdbFiles > 1 )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] Found more than 1 tbd file in workspace directory \\"%s\\"! Total files " .
-\t\t\t\t"found (%u):\
\
%s\
\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t$projectDirectoryPath,
-\t\t\tscalar( @allTdbFiles ),
-\t\t\tjoin( "\
\\t", sort( @allTdbFiles ) )
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\'System model file for workspace "%s" is "%s".\',
-\t\t$projectDirectoryPath,
-\t\t$allTdbFiles[ 0 ]
-\t);
-
-\treturn $allTdbFiles[ 0 ];
-}
-
-# This function returns the absolute path of the AUTOSAR workspace directory to use for the
-# specified project / variant.
-sub __getWorkspaceDirectoryPath($$$$)
-{
-\tmy ( $workspacesAreInThisDir, $projectName, $variantPath, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\'Call parameters: $workspacesAreInThisDir: %s, $projectName: %s, $variantPath: %s.\',
-\t\tdefined( $workspacesAreInThisDir ) ? "\\"$workspacesAreInThisDir\\"" : \'<undef>\',
-\t\tdefined( $projectName ) ? "\\"$projectName\\"" : \'<undef>\',
-\t\tComponentBuildModules::BuildVariantsHandler::sayVariant( $variantPath )
-\t);
-
-\tmy $simplifiedWorkspaceParentDir = FileUtil::simplifyPath( $workspacesAreInThisDir );
-
-\tif ( $simplifiedWorkspaceParentDir eq \'\' )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] Must specify path of directory which contains all workspaces!\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext()
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\tif ( ! -d $workspacesAreInThisDir )
-\t{
-\t\tif ( -f $workspacesAreInThisDir )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] Root directory path for AUTOSAR workspaces \\"%s\\" exists, but it is " .
-\t\t\t\t\t"file rather than a directory!\
",
-\t\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t\t$workspacesAreInThisDir
-\t\t\t);
-\t\t}
-
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] Root directory \\"%s\\" for any AUTOSAR workspaces does not exist!\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t$workspacesAreInThisDir
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\tmy $trimmedProjectName = StringFuncs::trim( $projectName );
-
-\tif ( $trimmedProjectName eq \'\' )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf( "ERROR: [%s] No project name specified!\
", Context::getContext() );
-\t}
-
-\tmy $cleanedVariantPath = ComponentBuildModules::BuildVariantsHandler::cleanVariantPath(
-\t\t$variantPath,
-\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t);
-
-\tif ( $cleanedVariantPath eq \'\' )
-\t{
-\t\t# No variant path specified -> we\'re building the main variant.
-\t\tmy $workspaceDirToUse = FileUtil::join( $simplifiedWorkspaceParentDir, $trimmedProjectName );
-
-\t\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\t\'$cleanedVariantPath is empty for project %s. Using default workspace %s.\',
-\t\t\t$trimmedProjectName,
-\t\t\t$workspaceDirToUse
-\t\t);
-
-\t\treturn $workspaceDirToUse;
-\t}
-
-\treturn __selectWorkspaceForSubvariant(
-\t\t$simplifiedWorkspaceParentDir,
-\t\t$cleanedVariantPath,
-\t\t$trimmedProjectName,
-\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t);
-}
-
-sub __selectWorkspaceForSubvariant($$$$)
-{
-\tmy ( $simplifiedWorkspaceParentDir, $cleanedVariantPath, $trimmedProjectName, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tmy @variantPathPieces = FileUtil::splitPathIntoList( $cleanedVariantPath );
-\tassert( @variantPathPieces );
-
-\tmy @workspacesTried = ();
-
-\twhile ( TRUE )
-\t{
-\t\tmy $pathToTry = FileUtil::join(
-\t\t\t$simplifiedWorkspaceParentDir,
-\t\t\tjoin( \'_\', $trimmedProjectName, @variantPathPieces )
-\t\t);
-
-\t\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\t\'Checking if workspace directory "%s" exists (project: %s, variant: %s).\',
-\t\t\t$pathToTry,
-\t\t\t$trimmedProjectName,
-\t\t\tComponentBuildModules::BuildVariantsHandler::sayVariant( $cleanedVariantPath )
-\t\t);
-
-\t\tif ( -e $pathToTry )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tif ( -f $pathToTry )
-\t\t\t{
-\t\t\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] AUTOSAR workspace path \\"%s\\" (project: %s, variant: %s) exists " .
-\t\t\t\t\t\t"but is a file rather than a directory!\
",
-\t\t\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t\t\t$pathToTry,
-\t\t\t\t\t$trimmedProjectName,
-\t\t\t\t\tjoin( \'/\', @variantPathPieces )
-\t\t\t\t);
-\t\t\t}
-
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\t\t\'Workspace directory "%s" exists (project: %s, variant: %s). Returning.\',
-\t\t\t\t$pathToTry,
-\t\t\t\t$trimmedProjectName,
-\t\t\t\tComponentBuildModules::BuildVariantsHandler::sayVariant( $cleanedVariantPath )
-\t\t\t);
-
-\t\t\treturn $pathToTry;
-\t\t}
-
-\t\tpush( @workspacesTried, $pathToTry );
-
-\t\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\t\'Workspace directory "%s" does not exist (project: %s, variant: %s).\',
-\t\t\t$pathToTry,
-\t\t\t$trimmedProjectName,
-\t\t\tComponentBuildModules::BuildVariantsHandler::sayVariant( $cleanedVariantPath )
-\t\t);
-
-\t\tif ( ! @variantPathPieces )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tlast;
-\t\t}
-
-\t\tpop( @variantPathPieces );
-\t}
-
-\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t"ERROR: [%s] Failed to select an AUTOSAR workspace from base directory \\"%s\\" (for " .
-\t\t\t"project %s, variant %s)! Tried the following %u paths:\
\
\\t%s\
\
",
-\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t$simplifiedWorkspaceParentDir,
-\t\t$trimmedProjectName,
-\t\tComponentBuildModules::BuildVariantsHandler::sayVariant( $cleanedVariantPath ),
-\t\tscalar( @workspacesTried ),
-\t\tjoin( "\
\\t", @workspacesTried )
-\t);
-}
-
-sub __getParsed_AUTOSAR_config($$$)
-{
-\tmy ( $self, $onlyWantHelp, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tmy $parsedConfig = $$self{ \'parsedConfig\' };
-
-\tif ( ! defined( $parsedConfig ) )
-\t{
-\t\t# AUTOSAR config hasn\'t been parsed yet, so do it now.
-\t\tmy $componentConfigReader = __getComponentConfigReader( $self );
-
-\t\tmy %parsed = $componentConfigReader->parse_AUTOSAR_config(
-\t\t\t__getImportantPathsDict( $self ),
-\t\t\t__getDynamicVarsReader( $self ),
-\t\t\t$onlyWantHelp,
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t);
-
-\t\t$parsedConfig = $$self{ \'parsedConfig\' } = \\%parsed;
-\t}
-
-\treturn %$parsedConfig;
-}
-
-sub __getFinal_AUTOSAR_config($$)
-{
-\tmy ( $self, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tmy $finalConfig = $$self{ \'finalConfig\' };
-
-\tif ( ! defined( $finalConfig ) )
-\t{
-\t\t# Final AUTOSAR config not yet obtained, so do it now.
-\t\tmy %parsedAutosarConfig = __getParsed_AUTOSAR_config( $self, FALSE, $dbgLogger );
-
-\t\tmy %finalConfig = __obtainFinal_AUTOSAR_config(
-\t\t\t__getImportantPathsDict( $self ),
-\t\t\t__getSelectedVariantPath( $self ),
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t\t%parsedAutosarConfig
-\t\t);
-
-\t\t$finalConfig = $$self{ \'finalConfig\' } = \\%finalConfig;
-\t}
-
-\treturn %$finalConfig;
-}
-
-sub __getDynamicVarsReader($)
-{
-\tmy ( $self ) = @_;
-
-\tmy $dynamicVarsReader = $$self{ \'dynamicVarsReader\' };
-\tassert( defined( $dynamicVarsReader ) );
-\treturn $dynamicVarsReader;
-}
-
-sub __getSelectedVariantPath($)
-{
-\tmy ( $self ) = @_;
-
-\tmy $selectedVariantPath = $$self{ \'variantPath\' };
-
-\tif ( ! defined( $selectedVariantPath ) )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] Internal logic error! Path of selected variant not set!\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext()
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\treturn $selectedVariantPath;
-}
-
-sub __getComponentConfigReader($)
-{
-\tmy ( $self ) = @_;
-
-\tmy $componentConfigReader = $$self{ \'componentConfigReader\' };
-
-\tassert( defined( $componentConfigReader ) );
-\treturn $componentConfigReader
-}
-
-sub __getImportantPathsDict($)
-{
-\tmy ( $self ) = @_;
-
-\tmy $importantPaths = $$self{ \'importantPaths\' };
-\tassert( defined( $importantPaths ) );
-\treturn $importantPaths;
-}
-
-# Returns true if the component uses the AUTOSAR tool chain at all. This depends exclusively on
-# whether the AUTOSAR section in the ComponentConfig.xml file is populated with info or not.
-sub __componentUses_AUTOSAR_toolchain($$$)
-{
-\tmy ( $self, $onlyWantHelp, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tmy %parsedAutosarConfig = __getParsed_AUTOSAR_config( $self, $onlyWantHelp, $dbgLogger );
-
-\tmy $componentUsesAutosar = keys( %parsedAutosarConfig ) ? TRUE : FALSE;
-
-\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\'Component uses AUTOSAR: %s\',
-\t\tStringFuncs::boolalpha( $componentUsesAutosar )
-\t);
-
-\treturn $componentUsesAutosar;
-}
-
-# Returns true if use of the AUTOSAR tool chain is principally enabled, given the target / options
-# specified by the user. NOTE that just because use of the AUTOSAR tool chain is __principally__
-# enabled, doesn\'t mean it will actually be used. If a target doesn\'t need it, it obviously won\'t
-# be used.
-sub __useOf_AUTOSAR_principallyEnabled($$$$)
-{
-\tmy ( $self, $buildEnvType, $componentName, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tmy %parsedAutosarConfig = __getParsed_AUTOSAR_config( $self, FALSE, $dbgLogger );
-
-\tif ( ! keys( %parsedAutosarConfig ) )
-\t{
-\t\t# Component doesn\'t use AUTOSAR at all.
-\t\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\t\'Use of AUTOSAR tool chain completely disabled because component %s doesn\\\'t use \' .
-\t\t\t\t\'AUTOSAR at all.\',
-\t\t\t$componentName
-\t\t);
-
-\t\treturn FALSE;
-\t}
-
-\tif ( $buildEnvType eq \'EOL_BE\' )
-\t{
-\t\t# EOL mode never needs AUTOSAR.
-\t\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\t\'Component %s principally uses AUTOSAR tool chain, but AUTOSAR build disabled because \' .
-\t\t\t\t\'we\\\'re running an EOL build.\',
-\t\t\t$componentName
-\t\t);
-
-\t\treturn FALSE;
-\t}
-
-\tif ( $buildEnvType eq \'OEM_BE\' )
-\t{
-\t\tmy $buildAutosarIn_OEM_BE = $parsedAutosarConfig{ \'buildIn_OEM_BE\' };
-
-\t\tif ( ! $buildAutosarIn_OEM_BE )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\t\t\'Component %s principally uses AUTOSAR tool chain, but AUTOSAR build disabled \' .
-\t\t\t\t\t\'because we\\\'re running an OEM build, and in this component the AUTOSAR build \' .
-\t\t\t\t\t\'is not enabled in the OEM-BE.\',
-\t\t\t\t$componentName
-\t\t\t);
-\t\t}
-
-\t\treturn $buildAutosarIn_OEM_BE;
-\t}
-
-\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\'Use of AUTOSAR tool chain in component %s principally enabled.\',
-\t\t$componentName
-\t);
-
-\treturn TRUE;
-}
-
-1;

-package A2L_Lib2::Document;

-use strict;
-use warnings FATAL => \'all\';

-# tools/cm imports

-use A2L_Lib2::Common;

-use A2L_Lib2::ItemReference;

-use A2L_Lib2::ItemTypes::MEMORY_SEGMENT;

-use constant FALSE => 0;
-use constant TRUE => ! FALSE;
-
-use constant ENABLE_REFERENCE_INFO_CACHING => TRUE;
-
-# Dictionary that maps the various TYPEDEF_* items that may appear in an A2L document to the
-# concrete item types that can be defined via those typedefs.
-#
-# NOTE: We\'re omitting the TYPEDEF_STRUCTURE type because it\'s not really relevant for parameter-
-# related tasks.
-#
-#      name of typedef                       name of concrete
-#       type                                  item type
-use constant TYPEDEF_INFO => qw(
-\tTYPEDEF_MEASUREMENT                     MEASUREMENT
-\tTYPEDEF_CHARACTERISTIC                  CHARACTERISTIC
-\tTYPEDEF_AXIS                            AXIS_PTS
-);
-
-# Fixed-position fields can use these keywords to denote that they are not used to reference an
-# actual item of the type they normally refer to.
-#
-#      name of the type the          keyword to denote that a reference
-#       reference may refer to        doesn\'t actually point to an item
-use constant NULL_REFERENCE_KEYWORDS => qw(
-\tMEASUREMENT                      NO_INPUT_QUANTITY
-\tCOMPU_METHOD                     NO_COMPU_METHOD
-);
-
-# This list contains the names of all referencable item types that must remain in the document even
-# if they\'re not referenced by any other items.
-#
-# NOTE #1: Items may still be removed anyway if they\'re determined to be completely empty.
-#
-# NOTE #2: AXIS_PTS items are __not__ primary item types because they only exist to be used to
-# define the axes of CHARACTERISTIC items! We will still keep them instead of just silently throwing
-# them away so we can warn about such issues during semantic analysis of A2L parameter info.
-#
-# NOTE #3: In truth, GROUP items are only primary items if they have the \'ROOT\' keyword! For now,
-# though, we\'ll just treat __all__ GROUP items as primary reference types.
-use constant PRIMARY_REFERENCE_ITEM_TYPES => (
-\tqw(
-\t\tAXIS_PTS
-\t\tCHARACTERISTIC
-\t\tMEASUREMENT
-\t\tFUNCTION
-\t\tGROUP
-\t),
-
-\tA2L_Lib2::ItemTypes::MEMORY_SEGMENT::MEMORY_SEGMENT_TYPES
-);
-
-# Creates a new instance of the A2L_Lib2::Document class by parsing the A2L file in $a2lInputArg.
-#
-# The %options dictionary may have the following entries:
-#
-# \'noTiming\' -> Boolean that, if true, suppresses any timing related printouts.
-#
-# \'lenient\'  -> Reference to a dictionary specifying which potential issues should be handled in a
-#               lenient manner (i.e. treated as warnings instead of errors). Currently, the follwing
-#               issues are recognized:
-#
-#              \'UNUSED_AXIS_PTS\'
-#              \'INVALID_IDENTIFIERS\'
-sub new
-{
-\tmy ( $class, $a2lInputArg, $dbgLogger, %options ) = @_;
-
-\t%options = __preprocessOptions( $dbgLogger, %options );
-
-\tmy ( $unblessedInstance, $itemTypePluginManager ) = __initByParsing(
-\t\t$a2lInputArg,
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t%options
-\t);
-
-\tassert( defined( $unblessedInstance ) );
-\tassert( defined( $itemTypePluginManager ) );
-
-\t$$unblessedInstance{ \'itemTypePluginManager\' } = $itemTypePluginManager;
-\treturn bless $unblessedInstance, ref $class || $class;
-}
-
-# This is a convenience extension on top of the getFromArtefactCatalog() function that offers the
-# following additional feature:
-#
-# As an alternative to a logical A2L input artifact name, you can also specify an A2L input file
-# path. If you do, it is ok for the $artefactCatalogInstanceOrFilePath and $baseForRelativeArtefactPaths
-# arguments to be undef / empty (as they won\'t be needed).
-#
-# The function returns a list containing the following:
-#
-# 0) Reference to the A2L_Lib2::Document instance restored via the artifact catalog or parsed from
-#    the input A2L file.
-#
-# 1) Reference to the FileUtil::Pickling::Unchecked::ArtefactCatalog instance created by parsing
-#    the file in $artefactCatalogInstanceOrFilePath or the instance that was passed in
-#    $artefactCatalogInstanceOrFilePath. Note that this may be undef, if and only if, the
-#    $logicalArtefactNameOrFilePath argument was a file path rather than a logical artifact name.
-sub restoreFromArtifactCatalogOrParse($$$$$%)
-{
-\tmy (
-\t\t$class,
-\t\t$artefactCatalogInstanceOrFilePath,
-\t\t$baseForRelativeArtefactPaths,
-\t\t$logicalArtefactNameOrFilePath,
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t%options
-\t) = @_;
-
-\tif ( StringFuncs::null( $logicalArtefactNameOrFilePath ) )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] No logical input A2L artifact name or A2L input file path passed!\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext()
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\tif ( FileUtil::isFullyAbsolute( $logicalArtefactNameOrFilePath, $dbgLogger ) )
-\t{
-\t\t# We\'ve been passed an absolute path name rather than a logical artifact name. Just parse
-\t\t# the A2L file.
-\t\tmy $a2lDocument = $class->new( $logicalArtefactNameOrFilePath, $dbgLogger, %options );
-\t\treturn ( $a2lDocument, undef );
-\t}
-
-\t# We\'ve been given a logical artifact name. Just use the getFromArtefactCatalog() function to
-\t# restore the artifact.
-\tif ( StringFuncs::null( $artefactCatalogInstanceOrFilePath ) )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] The \\$logicalArtefactNameOrFilePath argument appears to be a logical " .
-\t\t\t\t"artifact name (%s), but the \\$artefactCatalogInstanceOrFilePath argument is " .
-\t\t\t\t"either undef or empty!\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t$logicalArtefactNameOrFilePath
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\tmy $artefactCatalog;
-
-\tif ( FileUtil::isFullyAbsolute( $artefactCatalogInstanceOrFilePath, $dbgLogger ) )
-\t{
-\t\tif ( StringFuncs::null( $baseForRelativeArtefactPaths ) )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] The \\$artefactCatalogInstanceOrFilePath argument appears to be a file " .
-\t\t\t\t\t"path (%s) rather than an instance of FileUtil::Pickling::Unchecked::ArtefactCatalog," .
-\t\t\t\t\t" but the \\$baseForRelativeArtefactPaths argument is either undef or empty!\
",
-\t\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t\t$artefactCatalogInstanceOrFilePath
-\t\t\t);
-\t\t}
-
-\t\t# Artifact catalog passed in the shape of a file path rather than as an instance of
-\t\t# FileUtil::Pickling::Unchecked::ArtefactCatalog.
-\t\t$artefactCatalog = FileUtil::Pickling::Unchecked::ArtefactCatalog->loadArtefactCatalog(
-\t\t\t$artefactCatalogInstanceOrFilePath,
-\t\t\t$baseForRelativeArtefactPaths,
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t);
-\t}
-\telse
-\t{
-\t\t# Artifact catalog passed as an instance of FileUtil::Pickling::Unchecked::ArtefactCatalog.
-\t\t$artefactCatalog = $artefactCatalogInstanceOrFilePath;
-\t}
-
-\tmy $a2lDocument = $class->getFromArtefactCatalog(
-\t\t$artefactCatalog,
-\t\t$logicalArtefactNameOrFilePath,
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t%options
-\t);
-
-\treturn ( $a2lDocument, $artefactCatalog );
-}
-
-# Attempts to restore the A2L_Lib2::Document instance in memory from an existing pickled artifact
-# (blazingly fast). If this is not possible, creates the A2L_Lib2::Document instance by parsing the
-# underlying A2L file (quite slow).
-sub getFromArtefactCatalog($$$$%)
-{
-\tmy ( $class, $artefactCatalog, $logicalArtefactName, $dbgLogger, %options ) = @_;
-
-\tif ( StringFuncs::null( $artefactCatalog ) )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] No artifact catalog instance passed!\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext()
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\tif ( StringFuncs::null( $logicalArtefactName ) )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] No logical input A2L artifact name passed!\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext()
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\tmy $timeAtStart = Time::HiRes::time();
-
-\tmy $newInstance;
-
-\tmy ( undef, $restoreInstanceFromThisRawData ) = $artefactCatalog->getArtefactPickle(
-\t\t$logicalArtefactName,
-
-\t\t# rebuild-function (if artefact could not be restored from an existing pickle)
-\t\tsub {
-\t\t\tmy ( $absoluteArtefactPath, $isPureInternal, $dbgLogger_ ) = @_;
-
-\t\t\t# Call normal constructor (i.e. parse the A2L file).
-\t\t\t$newInstance = $class->new( $absoluteArtefactPath, $dbgLogger_, %options );
-
-\t\t\treturn $newInstance->__getRawDataForPickling( $dbgLogger_ );
-\t\t},
-\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t);
-
-\tif ( defined( $newInstance ) )
-\t{
-\t\t# No matching pickle was available. Instance had to be created from scratch by parsing A2L
-\t\t# file.
-\t\treturn $newInstance;
-\t}
-
-\t# Raw data loaded from an existing pickle.
-\tassert( defined( $restoreInstanceFromThisRawData ) );
-
-\tif ( ! $options{ \'noTiming\' } )
-\t{
-\t\tmy $duration = Time::HiRes::time() - $timeAtStart;
-\t\tif ( $duration < 0.0 ) { $duration = 0.0; }
-
-\t\tprintf(
-\t\t\t"NOTE: %s Took %u.%03u seconds to restore A2L document from pickled logical artifact %s.\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getPackageContextWithTimeStampString(),
-\t\t\t$duration,
-\t\t\t( $duration - int( $duration ) ) * 1000,
-\t\t\t$logicalArtefactName
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\treturn bless $restoreInstanceFromThisRawData, ref $class || $class;
-}
-
-sub compareDocumentContents($$$)
-{
-\tmy ( $firstDoc, $secondDoc, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tif ( ! defined( $firstDoc ) )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf( "ERROR: [%s] First document not specified!\
", Context::getContext() );
-\t}
-
-\tif ( ! defined( $secondDoc ) )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf( "ERROR: [%s] Second document not specified!\
", Context::getContext() );
-\t}
-
-\tmy $contentDictOfFirstDoc = $$firstDoc{ \'itemsByType\' };
-
-\tif ( ! defined( $contentDictOfFirstDoc ) )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] First argument is not a valid A2L_Document instance!\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext()
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\tmy $contentDictOfSecondDoc = $$secondDoc{ \'itemsByType\' };
-
-\tif ( ! defined( $contentDictOfSecondDoc ) )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] Seond argument is not a valid A2L_Document instance!\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext()
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\tmy $contentsAreEqual = Data::Compare::Compare( $contentDictOfFirstDoc, $contentDictOfSecondDoc );
-
-\t$dbgLogger->print( sub {
-\t\treturn sprintf(
-\t\t\t\'Contents of first document (%s) and second document (%s) %s.\',
-\t\t\t$$firstDoc{ \'originalDocType\' },
-\t\t\t$$secondDoc{ \'originalDocType\' },
-\t\t\t$contentsAreEqual ? \'are equal\' : \'differ\'
-\t\t);
-\t} );
-
-\treturn $contentsAreEqual;
-}
-
-sub saveToArtefactCatalog($$$$)
-{
-\tmy ( $self, $artefactCatalog, $logicalArtefactName, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tif ( StringFuncs::null( $artefactCatalog ) )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] No artifact catalog instance passed!\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext()
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\tif ( StringFuncs::null( $logicalArtefactName ) )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] No logical output A2L artifact name passed!\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext()
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\tmy $timeAtStart = Time::HiRes::time();
-
-\t$artefactCatalog->saveArtefact(
-\t\t$logicalArtefactName,
-\t\tsub {
-\t\t\tmy ( $absoluteArtefactPath, $isPureInternal, $dbgLogger_ ) = @_;
-
-\t\t\tif ( $isPureInternal )
-\t\t\t{
-\t\t\t\tprintf(
-\t\t\t\t\t"NOTE: %s Not saving primary A2L artifact %s (%s), as this is a pure " .
-\t\t\t\t\t\t"internal artefact.\
",
-\t\t\t\t\tContext::getPackageContextWithTimeStampString(),
-\t\t\t\t\t$logicalArtefactName,
-\t\t\t\t\t$absoluteArtefactPath
-\t\t\t\t);
-\t\t\t}
-\t\t\telse
-\t\t\t{
-\t\t\t\tserialize( $self, $absoluteArtefactPath, $dbgLogger_ );
-\t\t\t}
-
-\t\t\treturn __getRawDataForPickling( $self, $absoluteArtefactPath, $dbgLogger_ );
-\t\t},
-\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t);
-
-\tmy $instanceOptions = $$self{ \'options\' };
-\tassert( defined( $instanceOptions ) );
-
-\tif ( ! $$instanceOptions{ \'noTiming\' } )
-\t{
-\t\tmy $duration = Time::HiRes::time() - $timeAtStart;
-\t\tif ( $duration < 0.0 ) { $duration = 0.0; }
-
-\t\tprintf(
-\t\t\t"NOTE: %s Took %u.%03u seconds to save A2L document as logical artifact %s.\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getPackageContextWithTimeStampString(),
-\t\t\t$duration,
-\t\t\t( $duration - int( $duration ) ) * 1000,
-\t\t\t$logicalArtefactName
-\t\t);
-\t}
-}
-
-sub __getRawDataForPickling($$$)
-{
-\tmy ( $self, $absoluteArtefactPath, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\t# Return an unblessed copy of the instance data dictionary without the
-\t# itemTypePluginManager entry.
-\t# The itemTypePluginManager contains problematic code references and at any rate, it
-\t# can easily be restored later if it is needed.
-\tmy %rawData = %$self;
-\tdelete $rawData{ \'itemTypePluginManager\' };
-\t$rawData{ \'originalDocType\' } = sprintf( \'A2L file "%s"\', $absoluteArtefactPath );
-\treturn \\%rawData;
-}
-
-sub __getMetaDataCategoriesForNamespace
-{
-\tmy ( $self, $projectName, $moduleName, $namespace, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tmy @itemTypes = ();
-
-\tif ( $namespace eq \'calibratable\' )
-\t{
-\t\tpush( @itemTypes, \'CHARACTERISTIC\', \'MEASUREMENT\', \'AXIS_PTS\', \'BLOB\' );
-\t}
-\telsif ( $namespace eq \'functions\' )
-\t{
-\t\tpush( @itemTypes, \'FUNCTION\' );
-\t}
-\telse
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] Unsupported namespace string \'%s\'!\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t$namespace
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\treturn map {
-\t\t__getMetaDataCacheForType( $self, $projectName, $moduleName, $_, $dbgLogger );
-\t} @itemTypes
-}
-
-sub getItemsInNamespace($$$$$$)
-{
-\tmy ( $self, $projectName, $moduleName, $namespace, $asDict, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tmy @metaDataCategories = __getMetaDataCategoriesForNamespace(
-\t\t$self,
-\t\t$projectName,
-\t\t$moduleName,
-\t\t$namespace,
-\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t);
-\tassert( @metaDataCategories );
-
-\tmy %items = ();
-
-\tforeach my $metaDataCategory ( @metaDataCategories )
-\t{
-\t\tforeach my $itemKey ( keys( %$metaDataCategory ) )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tmy $metaDataInstance = $$metaDataCategory{ $itemKey };
-
-\t\t\tmy $element = $$metaDataInstance{ \'element\' };
-\t\t\tassert( defined( $element ) );
-
-\t\t\t$items{ $itemKey } = $element;
-\t\t}
-\t}
-
-\treturn $asDict ? %items : values( %items );
-}
-
-# Renames the specifies items and updates any references to these items that other items may hold.
-# The %replacements maps the old item names to the new ones. If the new name of an item is either
-# undef or an empty string, the item will be removed instead of renamed. If any of the items
-# mentioned in %replacements don\'t exist in the document, the method raises an exception.
-#
-# Example content of %replacements:
-#
-# my %replacements = (
-#     # Currently, \'calibratable\' is the only supported namespace, but this may change in the
-#     # future. The \'calibratable\' namespace includes any calibratable objects, i.e. MEASUREMENT,
-#     # AXIS_PTS, CHARACTERISTIC, BLOB and INSTANCE items.
-#     \'calibratable\' => {
-#         \'My_CHARACTERISTIC_A\' => undef, # <- this one will be deleted
-#         \'My_CHARACTERISTIC_B\' => \'newNameFor_My_CHARACTERISTIC_B\' # <- this is going to
-#     }
-# );
-#
-# Beware that, if any elements are removed from the document, the function performs a cleanup,
-# which may result in additional elements being removed as a consquence of this cleanup (if they
-# have become either empty or unreferenced, or if they already were empty or unreferenced to begin
-# with).
-#
-# The method doesn\'t return anything.
-sub renameItems($$$$$%)
-{
-\tmy (
-\t\t$self,
-\t\t$projectName,
-\t\t$moduleName,
-\t\t$allowRemovalOfDependentItems,
-\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t%replacements
-\t) = @_;
-
-\tif ( StringFuncs::null( $projectName ) )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf( "ERROR: [%s] No project name specified!\
", Context::getContext() );
-\t}
-
-\tif ( StringFuncs::null( $moduleName ) )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] No module name specified (project name was %s)!\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t$projectName
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\tmy @sortedNamespaces = sort( keys( %replacements ) );
-
-\tif ( ! @sortedNamespaces )
-\t{
-\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] %%replacements dictionary does not contain any namespaces (for project " .
-\t\t\t\t"%s / module %s)!\
",
-\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t$projectName,
-\t\t\t$moduleName
-\t\t);
-\t}
-
-\tmy $instanceOptions = $$self{ \'options\' };
-\tassert( defined( $instanceOptions ) );
-
-\tmy %lenientOptions = A2L_Lib2::Util::getLenientOptionsDict( $dbgLogger, %$instanceOptions );
-
-\tforeach my $namespace ( @sortedNamespaces )
-\t{
-\t\tmy $replacementsForThisNamespace = $replacements{ $namespace };
-
-\t\tif ( ! defined( $replacementsForThisNamespace ) )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] Missing replacements subdictionary in %%replacements dictionary for " .
-\t\t\t\t\t" namespace \'%s\' (for project %s / module %s)!\
",
-\t\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t\t$namespace,
-\t\t\t\t$projectName,
-\t\t\t\t$moduleName
-\t\t\t);
-\t\t}
-
-\t\tmy $refType = ref( $replacementsForThisNamespace );
-
-\t\tif ( $refType ne \'HASH\' )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tlocal( $Data::Dumper::Sortkeys ) = 1;
-\t\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] Expected \\$replacements{ %s } to be a \'HASH\', but it is \'%s\'! " .
-\t\t\t\t\t"Complete dump of %%replacements:\
\
%s\
\
",
-\t\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t\t$refType,
-\t\t\t\tData::Dumper::Dumper( \\%replacements )
-\t\t\t);
-\t\t}
-
-\t\tmy @oldNames = sort( keys( %$replacementsForThisNamespace ) );
-
-\t\t# if ( ! @oldNames )
-\t\t# {
-\t\t\t# die sprintf(
-\t\t\t\t# "ERROR: [%s] Replacements subdictionary in %%replacements dictionary for " .
-\t\t\t\t\t# " namespace \'%s\' does not contain any old name -> new name mappings (for " .
-\t\t\t\t\t# "project %s / module %s)!\
",
-\t\t\t\t# Context::getContext(),
-\t\t\t\t# $namespace,
-\t\t\t\t# $projectName,
-\t\t\t\t# $moduleName
-\t\t\t# );
-\t\t# }
-
-\t\tmy @metaDataCategories = __getMetaDataCategoriesForNamespace(
-\t\t\t$self,
-\t\t\t$projectName,
-\t\t\t$moduleName,
-\t\t\t$namespace,
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t);
-\t\tassert( @metaDataCategories );
-
-\t\tmy @metaDataOfItemsToDelete = ();
-\t\tmy %referencesToUpdate = ();
-
-\t\tmy %renamedItems = ();
-
-\t\tforeach my $oldName ( @oldNames )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tmy $trimmedOldName = StringFuncs::trim( $oldName );
-
-\t\t\tif ( $trimmedOldName eq \'\' )
-\t\t\t{
-\t\t\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] Empty initial name string in %%replacements dictionary for " .
-\t\t\t\t\t\t"namespace \'%s\'!\
",
-\t\t\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t\t\t$namespace
-\t\t\t\t);
-\t\t\t}
-
-\t\t\tmy $newName = StringFuncs::trim( $$replacementsForThisNamespace{ $trimmedOldName } );
-
-\t\t\tmy ( $metaDataOfItemToRemoveOrRename, $inMetaTypeDict ) = __findItemInTheseMetaDataDicts(
-\t\t\t\t$trimmedOldName,
-\t\t\t\tTRUE,
-\t\t\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t\t\t@metaDataCategories
-\t\t\t);
-\t\t\tassert( defined( $metaDataOfItemToRemoveOrRename ) );
-\t\t\tassert( defined( $inMetaTypeDict ) );
-
-\t\t\tif ( $newName eq \'\' )
-\t\t\t{
-\t\t\t\t# $newName is emtpy or undef -> item is to be removed instead of renamed.
-\t\t\t\tpush( @metaDataOfItemsToDelete, $metaDataOfItemToRemoveOrRename );
-\t\t\t}
-\t\t\telsif ( $newName eq $trimmedOldName )
-\t\t\t{
-\t\t\t\t# Old name same as new name. Ignore.
-\t\t\t\tnext;
-\t\t\t}
-\t\t\telse
-\t\t\t{
-\t\t\t\tA2L_Lib2::PredefinedDataTypes::assertValidIdentifier(
-\t\t\t\t\t$newName,
-\t\t\t\t\t$lenientOptions{ \'INVALID_IDENTIFIERS\' },
-\t\t\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t\t\t);
-
-\t\t\t\tmy $elementToRename = $$metaDataOfItemToRemoveOrRename{ \'element\' };
-\t\t\t\tassert( defined( $elementToRename ) );
-
-\t\t\t\t# There must not already exist an item with the same name in this namespace!
-\t\t\t\t#
-\t\t\t\t## @todo In the future we could re-arrange the order of renaming ops to at least
-\t\t\t\t## make name-swaps possible; i.e. ( nameA -> nameB ) and ( nameB -> nameA ).
-
-\t\t\t\tmy ( $metaDataOfExistingItemWithNewName, undef ) = __findItemInTheseMetaDataDicts(
-\t\t\t\t\t$newName,
-\t\t\t\t\tFALSE,
-\t\t\t\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t\t\t\t@metaDataCategories
-\t\t\t\t);
-
-\t\t\t\tmy $typeOfElementToRename = $$elementToRename{ \'type\' };
-\t\t\t\tassert( ! StringFuncs::null( $typeOfElementToRename ) );
-
-\t\t\t\tmy $renamedItemsOfThisType = $renamedItems{ $typeOfElementToRename };
-
-\t\t\t\tif ( ! defined( $renamedItemsOfThisType ) )
-\t\t\t\t{
-\t\t\t\t\t$renamedItemsOfThisType = $renamedItems{ $typeOfElementToRename } = {};
-\t\t\t\t}
-
-\t\t\t\t$$renamedItemsOfThisType{ $trimmedOldName } = $newName;
-
-\t\t\t\tif ( defined( $metaDataOfExistingItemWithNewName ) )
-\t\t\t\t{
-\t\t\t\t\tmy $element = $$metaDataOfExistingItemWithNewName{ \'element\' };
-\t\t\t\t\tassert( defined( $element ) );
-\t\t\t\t\tmy $typeOfExistingItem = $$element{ \'type\' };
-\t\t\t\t\tassert( ! StringFuncs::null( $typeOfExistingItem ) );
-
-\t\t\t\t\tdie sprintf(
-\t\t\t\t\t\t"ERROR: [%s] Cannot rename %s %s to %s (namespace %s, project %s / module " .
-\t\t\t\t\t\t\t"%s)! An item of the same name already exists in this namespace (%s %s)!\
",
-\t\t\t\t\t\tContext::getContext(),
-\t\t\t\t\t\t$typeOfElementToRename,
-\t\t\t\t\t\t$trimmedOldName,
-\t\t\t\t\t\t$newName,
-\t\t\t\t\t\t$namespace,
-\t\t\t\t\t\t$projectName,
-\t\t\t\t\t\t$moduleName,
-\t\t\t\t\t\t$typeOfExistingItem,
-\t\t\t\t\t\t$newName
-\t\t\t\t\t);
-\t\t\t\t}
-
-\t\t\t\t$$inMetaTypeDict{ $newName } = $metaDataOfItemToRemoveOrRename;
-\t\t\t\tdelete $$inMetaTypeDict{ $trimmedOldName };
-\t\t\t\t$$elementToRename{ \'name\' } = $newName;
-
-\t\t\t\t$referencesToUpdate{ $trimmedOldName } = $newName;
-
-\t\t\t\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\t\t\t\'%s %s renamed to %s (project %s / module %s).\',
-\t\t\t\t\t$typeOfElementToRename,
-\t\t\t\t\t$trimmedOldName,
-\t\t\t\t\t$newName,
-\t\t\t\t\t$projectName,
-\t\t\t\t\t$moduleName
-\t\t\t\t);
-\t\t\t}
-\t\t}
-
-\t\tif ( @metaDataOfItemsToDelete || keys( %renamedItems ) )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tmy $itemTypePluginManager = getItemTypePluginManager( $self, $dbgLogger );
-\t\t\tassert( defined( $itemTypePluginManager ) );
-
-\t\t\tmy (
-\t\t\t\tundef,
-\t\t\t\t$itemTypesThatMayReferenceItems
-\t\t\t) = A2L_Lib2::ItemTypePluginManager::getItemTypeReferenceRelationships(
-\t\t\t\t$itemTypePluginManager,
-\t\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t\t);
-
-\t\t\tmy %nullReferenceKeywordsTable = NULL_REFERENCE_KEYWORDS;
-
-\t\t\tmy %predefinedDataTypeLookupTable = A2L_Lib2::PredefinedDataTypes::makePredefinedDataTypeLookupTable(
-\t\t\t\t$dbgLogger,
-\t\t\t\tA2L_Lib2::Util::getLenientOptionsDict( $dbgLogger, %$instanceOptions )
-\t\t\t);
-
-\t\t\tmy $metaDataTypeDictForModule = __getMetaDataCacheForType(
-\t\t\t\t$self,
-\t\t\t\t$projectName,
-\t\t\t\t$moduleName,
-\t\t\t\tundef,
-\t\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t\t);
-
-\t\t\tmy %variablePositionFieldsLookupTable = A2L_Lib2::VariablePositionFields::VARIABLE_POSITION_FIELDS_LOOKUP_TABLE;
-
-\t\t\tmy $itemRefsInThisModule = __getItemReferencesInThisModule(
-\t\t\t\t$self,
-\t\t\t\t$projectName,
-\t\t\t\t$moduleName,
-\t\t\t\t$metaDataTypeDictForModule,
-\t\t\t\t$itemTypesThatMayReferenceItems,
-\t\t\t\t\\%variablePositionFieldsLookupTable,
-\t\t\t\t\\%nullReferenceKeywordsTable,
-\t\t\t\t\\%predefinedDataTypeLookupTable,
-\t\t\t\tFALSE,
-\t\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t\t);
-
-\t\t\t# Update our cached reference info to reflect the fact that the names of some items
-\t\t\t# holding references to other items have changed.
-\t\t\t__renameItemsInReferenceDict( $itemRefsInThisModule, \\%renamedItems, $dbgLogger );
-
-\t\t\tif ( @metaDataOfItemsToDelete )
-\t\t\t{
-\t\t\t\t__removeTheseElementsFromThisModule(
-\t\t\t\t\t$self,
-\t\t\t\t\t$projectName,
-\t\t\t\t\t$moduleName,
-\t\t\t\t\t\\@metaDataOfItemsToDelete,
-\t\t\t\t\tFALSE,
-\t\t\t\t\t$itemRefsInThisModule,
-\t\t\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t\t\t);
-
-\t\t\t\t__cleanUpModule(
-\t\t\t\t\t$self,
-\t\t\t\t\t$projectName,
-\t\t\t\t\t$moduleName,
-\t\t\t\t\tFALSE,
-\t\t\t\t\tFALSE,
-\t\t\t\t\t$allowRemovalOfDependentItems,
-\t\t\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t\t\t);
-\t\t\t}
-\t\t}
-
-\t\t## @todo At the moment, we only support one namespace, but once we support the various
-\t\t## other namespaces as well, the __getItemReferences method will run as many times as we
-\t\t## execute __renameReferencesInThisModule, which is unnecessarily wasteful! Find a better
-\t\t## way.
-\t\tif ( keys( %referencesToUpdate ) )
-\t\t{
-\t\t\t$dbgLogger->printf(
-\t\t\t\t\'Renamed %u labels in namespace "%s" (project %s / module %s). Updating references.\',
-\t\t\t\tscalar( keys( %referencesToUpdate ) ),
-\t\t\t\t$namespace,
-\t\t\t\t$projectName,
-\t\t\t\t$moduleName
-\t\t\t);
-
-\t\t\t__renameReferencesInThisModule(
-\t\t\t\t$self,
-\t\t\t\t$projectName,
-\t\t\t\t$moduleName,
-\t\t\t\t\\%referencesToUpdate,
-\t\t\t\t$dbgLogger
-\t\t\t);
-\t\t}
-\t}
-}
-
-sub __renameReferencesInThisModule($$$$$)
-{
-\tmy ( $self, $projectName, $moduleName, $oldNamesToNewNames, $dbgLogger ) = @_;
-
-\tmy $timeAtStart = Time::HiRes::time();
-
